Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a visionary games studio redefining the industry with top-tier mid-core games!




We‚Äôre seeking a skilled data analyst to collaborate with UA, Monetization, and game teams, using data to drive game production, business strategies, and market success!




Overview:

üíºData Analyst

üóìÔ∏èStart Date: Immediate




Responsibilities:

Use data to gain a deeper understanding of consumer behaviors.
Create strategies for customer segmentation, price optimization, lifetime value estimation and forecasting.
Develop experiments and mathematical models to identify opportunities for game optimization, helping developers enhance the player experience.




Requirements:

Mobile games experience 3+ years
Experience with SQL and Python, including experience in working with large data sets.
Experience working with data pipelines and modelling in a production environment.




How to Apply:




If you would love to find out more, contact me at fiona@eleven-eleven.io.




Applicants selected for an interview will be contacted directly.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

You will collaborate closely with the Business Intelligence Lead to analyze data trends, develop insightful reports, and contribute to the strategic execution of our advertising campaigns. Your expertise will help optimize our ad performance and ensure a successful peak season.

Key Responsibilities:

- Collaborate with Marketing Managers to align data analysis with overall Ads product strategy.

- Assist with the development and implementation of operational tools for peak season planning, becoming the go-to expert.

- Work with cross-functional teams to support operational excellence and drive automation initiatives.

- Engage with global stakeholders to provide data-driven insights and recommendations for Ads product enhancements.

- Take charge of data collection, analysis, and reporting tasks to support decision-making during Q4 peak season.

- Contribute to the design and execution of A/B testing to optimize campaign performance.

- Synthesize complex data into actionable reports for the marketing team and senior management.

- Assist in the management and quality assurance of campaign content and audience targeting.

Qualifications:

- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent experience.

- Minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analysis role ideally within a marketing or ad-tech environment.

- Proficient in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc.)

- Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.

- Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of handling multiple tasks with precision.

- Excellent communication skills, with the aptitude to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

- A proactive mindset, with a willingness to take initiative and drive projects forward.

- Adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




Your Responsibilities:

Management of and participation in Ecom&ERP projects in the BI environment
Implementation of change requests from the Ecom/CRM Team in the BI environment
Close cooperation with external service providers and partners
Ensuring operation & support for the BI systems of the Carhartt WIP Ecom&APP
Technical contact for the BI architecture in the ERP/Ecom environment




Your Profile:

Very good technical understanding of ERP, Commercetools and DWH architecture
At least 5 years of professional experience in a comparable function
Experience in working with Power BI is a plus
Entrepreneurial mindset and high customer orientation
Hands on and agile Mindset
Very good process understanding in the ecom&retail landscape
Very good technological understanding in the reporting area
Good analytical and logical thinking skills
Very good communication skills




Your Benefits:

Be part of the progress - find your place in our unique WIP culture
As part of the WIP crew you have the opportunity to connect at our events or just have fun
Your closet benefits from our staff discounts
Your future, our upgrade - we subsidise your company pension scheme by 100%
Your well-being is important to us - we contribute to this with free beverages




Your Location:

Berlin (Kreuzberg) / Germany

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As our new Decision Scientist, you‚Äôll become part of a cross-functional team in the Help Experience domain with a mission to enable an effortless, scalable and cost effective support experience for our Vinted members. Your team‚Äôs focus will be on supporting our Member Support function and enabling quality and efficiency improvements through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product we‚Äôre building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation ‚Äì translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of data science & analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you‚Äôll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyze identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst or a Strategic role with a strong data component.
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You‚Äôll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨69,000 - ‚Ç¨93,400 gross per year.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Lockers
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

The Vinted Go Points domain at Vinted Go is responsible for expanding and maintaining points (parcel lockers & shops that act as pick-up and drop-off points) network for our logistics operations. As a Decision Scientist, you will play a crucial role in optimising locker data usage for analytical purposes, gathering insights, and improving user flows by defining success metrics, conducting A/B tests, and creating insightful dashboards. Your responsibilities include ensuring a comprehensive view of locker performance, enhancing maintenance visibility, performing anomaly detection, and analysing recurring issues. This role also offers the opportunity to develop future capabilities for auto-detecting potential problems and upcoming maintenance needs to proactively address locker performance and user experience challenges.

We have three distinct roles within Data Science & Analytics (DSA). We believe each role can make a similar business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation ‚Äì translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identifying algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed optimally, and designing, developing, and maintaining production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


In this position, you‚Äôll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities, answer key business questions, improve, and maintain data products.
Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact.
Propose and implement key metrics that measure business performance, set up monitoring, and proactively flag issues.
Ensure requests are answered optimally (e.g., in the form of an ad hoc deep dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis).
Define the requirements for A/B testing and analyse the results of A/B tests.
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-service and dashboarding tools (Looker).
Closely collaborate with the product manager and help create a roadmap with prioritised hypotheses and analyses.


About You


Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes.
Strong communication skills, capable of presenting results to both technical and non-technical audiences convincingly.
Proficiency in dealing with technical challenges when building data products.
Entry to intermediate experience in the field of data analytics, typically 2+ years of work experience or equivalent proficiency.
Statistical proficiency, including A/B testing and regression analysis.
Fluent in SQL with practical experience in Python.
Experience with dashboarding tools such as Looker, Tableau, etc.
Advantageous: Experience collaborating with cross-functional product teams.
Advantageous: Background in logistics or e-commerce.


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You‚Äôll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨ 57,000 - ‚Ç¨ 77,100 gross per year.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst at Oetker Digital, you will play a critical role in owning and leveraging data to drive business decisions and strategies. You will work closely with various teams and business partners on the side of our Group companies to ask the right questions, deeply understand the business domains and processes, analyze datasets, generate insights and business cases based on data that help our brands grow and succeed in the digital space. Your expertise will guide the optimization of brand, marketing and sales strategies, product development, and customer engagement initiatives.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs and objectives
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key business partners to ensure data solutions align with business goals
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Analyze datasets to extract actionable insights and support data-driven decision making
Develop and implement statistical models to solve complex business problems
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights through effective data storytelling







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 5 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Experience in Marketing Analytics & Optimization
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
You like to learn, work hands-on, take ownership, and have an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year‚Äôs Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child‚Äôs sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to ‚Ç¨1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners







Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Vendor Sales & Operations (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Hero‚Äôs profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how should we prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

We focus on global initiative, and our main stakeholders are global product and business teams that are also focused on restaurant acquisition.

Your Mission:


Owning end to end the analytics part on multiple projects for the Vendor management team (this can vary from Competitor intelligence, VRM, Grading, AMC)
We focus on delivering data projects and adding value with actionable insights that help the business and product teams


What you need to be successful

Your Heroic Skills


Passion for data, problem-solving and generating actionable insights that impact the business
Highly proficient in SQL
Proficient in Data visualization and storytelling
Team player and ability to think outside the box
Communication skills
Business understanding


Nice to have:


Experience with process orchestrators (preferably DBT+Airflow)
Experience in AB Testing
Practical experience working with Git (or similar version control system)


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can‚Äôt wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Customer Data Analyst (Customer Segmentation) (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando‚Äôs Markets organization, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer focussed analytics and segmentations we put our customers at the center of every marketing and retail decision. As a (Senior) Customer Data Analyst in our Customer Segmentation Team you are the closest link to our customer You build a deep understanding of our customer base by developing and analyzing different customer segments based on their purchasing behavior, interests, customer value and onsite activities. You will transform data and segmentations into actionable insights and recommendations that drive strategic decisions and customer retention.

WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Develop and analyze customer segmentations and audiences, support targeting and steering initiatives to drive customer value and retention. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to optimize and productionalize your segmentations and audience selections.
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests to optimize your segmentations and audiences according to their use case. Recommend testing strategies to optimize targeted campaigns, campaign efficiency and ultimately customer value and retention. Translate complex questions into sound analytical tasks, autonomously planning large scale projects.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the customer strategy. Present your findings and work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to operationalize your recommendations.
Drive data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members in terms of methodology & technology to raise the bar within the department. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
Independently manage analytical projects, identifying efficiency opportunities and supporting decision-making with insights from descriptive and inferential analysis.
Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions, support junior colleagues, and contribute to internal events and the hiring process.



WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 3+ years experience in using customer data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions and/or drive targeting efforts incl. model driven statistical analysis, e.g. Causal Inference. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL, PySpark). Visualization tools, e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI and versioning tools, e.g. Git/GitHub, are considered a plus. Curious about learning new technologies, e.g. Databricks, AWS data lake, Airflow.
Strong communicator to challenge the status-quo, tell data stories, maximize decision impact of your results and liaison with commercial and tech people alike.
Proactive, fast learner, problem solver, teamplayer, comfortable working in English in a fast paced international work environment



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

Our employee resource groups

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

Zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als (Junior) Consultant Data Analytics (m/w/d) an den Standorten Berlin, D√ºsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Leipzig, M√ºnchen, Stuttgart und Walldorf.

Unsere Kunden digitalisieren kontinuierlich ihre Reporting-Prozesse und Data Analytics Landschaft. Du entwickelst Management Dashboards in Power BI, Tableau, Qlik oder SAP Analytics Cloud

Dein Profil

Idealerweise verf√ºgst du schon √ºber Branchenerfahrung in den Industrien Automotive, Mobility, Maschinen- und Anlagenbau, Logistik & Distribution, Konsumg√ºterindustrie & Handel oder Chemie & Pharma
Um unsere Kunden vor Ort optimal zu beraten, bist du bist bereit, national und international zu reisen
Sehr gute deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab




Together, we are more than Business

BearingPoint ist eine unabh√§ngige Management- und Technologieberatung mit europ√§ischen Wurzeln und globaler Reichweite. Wir bieten Beratung, die Strategie mit Technologie vereint und verbinden Unternehmertum mit Innovationsgeist.
Du machst den Unterschied: Wir geben dir den Raum, du selbst zu sein und dein volles Potenzial zu entfalten. Unabh√§ngig davon, woher du kommst, woran du glaubst oder wen du liebst.   • Vertrauensurlaub: Unser innovatives Konzept erm√∂glicht es dir, deine Erholungszeiten in Abstimmung mit deinem Team eigenverantwortlich und selbstbestimmt festzulegen
  • Verg√ºtungsmodell: Du profitierst von unserem attraktiven Modell inklusive eines erfolgsabh√§ngigen Bonus
  • Work-Life-Choice: Wir bieten dir hierzu umfangreiche Angebote ‚Äì dazu z√§hlen u. a. Sabbaticals oder Workation


Deine zuk√ºnftigen Aufgaben

Zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als (Junior) Consultant Data Analytics (m/w/d) an den Standorten Berlin, D√ºsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Leipzig, M√ºnchen, Stuttgart und Walldorf.

Unsere Kunden digitalisieren kontinuierlich ihre Reporting-Prozesse und Data Analytics Landschaft. Gemeinsam mit unserem erfahrenen Team unterst√ºtzt du beim Aufbau von innovativen Reporting & Analytics-Systemen, Data Analytics Plattformen oder Data Management Konzepten. In den Bereichen Automotive, Mobility, Maschinen- & Anlagenbau, Logistik & Distribution, Konsumg√ºter & Handel, Chemie und Pharma gestaltest du mit unseren Kunden die digitale Zukunft:

  • Du bearbeitest spannende Consulting-Themen wie Analytics-Strategie, oder die Konzeption und Realisierung von State-of-the Art Cloud-, AI- oder Analytics-Applikationen
  • Du ber√§tst unsere Kunden bei der Einf√ºhrung von Data Mesh, Data Fabric, Data Virtualization oder Datenkatalogen
  • Du lernst in einem sehr erfahrenen Team modernste Data Analytics Produkte wie AZURE, AWS, Snowflake, Databricks, SAP Datasphere oder Google Cloud Platform zu implementieren
  • Du entwickelst Management Dashboards in Power BI, Tableau, Qlik oder SAP Analytics Cloud

Dein Profil
  • Dein Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, des Wirtschaftsingenieurwesens, der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder √§hnlichem hast du erfolgreich absolviert

  • Idealerweise verf√ºgst du schon √ºber Branchenerfahrung in den Industrien Automotive, Mobility, Maschinen- und Anlagenbau, Logistik & Distribution, Konsumg√ºterindustrie & Handel oder Chemie & Pharma
  • Um unsere Kunden vor Ort optimal zu beraten, bist du bist bereit, national und international zu reisen

BearingPoint ist eine unabh√§ngige Management- und Technologieberatung mit europ√§ischen Wurzeln und globaler Reichweite. Wir bieten Beratung, die Strategie mit Technologie vereint und verbinden Unternehmertum mit Innovationsgeist.
Du machst den Unterschied: Wir geben dir den Raum, du selbst zu sein und dein volles Potenzial zu entfalten. Unabh√§ngig davon, woher du kommst, woran du glaubst oder wen du liebst. Title: Working Student ‚Äì Power Platform / BI data analyst
Description:
Company Statement

The new sustainability: want to join a renewable energy pioneer? Our mission is to advance large-scale photovoltaic to meet the growing global demand for clean electricity. Come be a part of our success story!

Intro Paragraph

The Working Student ‚Äì Power BI Data Analyst will assist in transforming data into insightful and actionable visualizations. By supporting the design and updating of interactive dashboards in Power BI, optimizing data workflows, and extracting data through SQL queries, this role contributes to data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your Job


Dashboard Creation & Updates: Design and create interactive automated data dashboards using Power BI. Update existing dashboards with new data and visualizations
Data Workflow Optimization: Design and implement improvements to ETL processes for smoother data ingestion into the dashboards
SQL Queries: Extract necessary data from SQL databases using well-written queries
UI dashboard Enhancements: Suggest and implement changes to create a user friendly Power BI dashboard and improve the overall usability
Stakeholder Communication: Follow-up and communicate updates, reports, and answer questions regarding the dashboards
(Bonus) Data Analysis: Conduct analysis using Python and Pandas for additional support and insights is a plus


Your profile


Currently enrolled in a program in the following fields: (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or similar)
Solid understanding of Power BI: dashboard creation, DAX, and visualization techniques
Experience with SQL and relational databases
Familiarity with data workflow/ETL concepts
Familiarity with other Microsoft power platform tools, such as Power automate, power app and co-pilot studio
Python and Pandas skills
Basic knowledge of UI/UX principles
Strong attention to detail and data accuracy
Excellent communication and organizational skills


We offer you


A truly international work environment with colleagues from around the world
An open-minded and highly motivated team
Interesting and challenging tasks and an opportunity to experience working with our global projects
We encourage both teamwork and personal responsibility
Great opportunities for professional and personal growth


About Us

ib vogt is firmly committed to supporting the decarbonisation of the global electricity sector. The company focuses on the global development of turnkey PV plants and battery storage projects as well as the expansion of its IPP portfolio. In these areas, the company performs all integral services of the value chain from development, financing, and EPC, to O&M and asset management.

Headquartered in Berlin, Germany, ib vogt has established various offices across Europe, Asia Pacific, the Americas, and Africa as part of its presence in over 40 countries. The company works together with numerous partners globally, augmenting its in-house team of over 900 staff. ib vogt has built or has in construction more than 4 GW of PV power plants globally with a project pipeline of more than 60 GWp.

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company‚Äôs performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What You‚Äôll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
4+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, we use Tableau
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Any team management experience, mentoring or managing 1-2 analyst is good to have
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Marketing or product related experience is good, not a must
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
Internal learning and development opportunities with the HelloFresh Academy
Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
Working parents support
Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, monthly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 2 days per week if preferred)
Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Senior Marketing Data Analyst

Berlin/Remote

‚Ç¨70,000 to ‚Ç¨90,000 (including bonus)+ Holiday + Benefit




Excellent opportunity to join a start-up in the entertainment and gaming sector changing the way users are able to consume content.




This company produces a platform which allows mobile games to be accessed by users while inspiring their loyalty through innovative features.




In this role you will a key role in building a reliable foundation for user acquisition data and help the UA team achieve company goals. This role involves validating and analysing the results of user acquisition efforts and providing valuable insights to improve performance. ?This is a great opportunity for any data analyst to take the lead in deep data analysis, identify growth opportunities, and ensure data accuracy.




The ideal candidate will be experienced in fast-paced B2C environments ideally within the mobile apps sector. You will have experience using SQL and Python and data visualization tools including Looker, Metabase and Tableau. Also with an in depth understanding of digital marketing strategies, as well as technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms




This is a fantastic opportunity to have a role where you can take ownership of projects working with a high degree of autonomy creating the long-term strategy of the product.




The Role:

Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards.
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Facebook, and TikTok.
Manage user LTV prediction tools, ensuring the LTV model‚Äôs reliability and data accuracy.
Research and revise the CPE targeting strategy for UA channels, and design the event implementation flow within our apps.
Develop UA alerts and reports automation.
Design and manage UA spend and revenue planning tools, and assist in setting goals for the UA team.
Manage MMP tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.




The Person:

You have a Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in a similar role.
You have proficiency with data analysis tools and programming languages, such as SQL, Python, etc. and data visualization tools (Looker, Metabase, Tableau)
You have a strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry and concrete experience with most major mobile marketing channels such Meta, Applovin, Google Ads or Unity and other networks / DSPs.
You have experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase etc.
You have in-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well as technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.




Reference Number: BBBH231059




To apply for this role or to be considered for further roles, please click "Apply Now" or contact Alexandra House at Rise Technical Recruitment.




Rise Technical Recruitment GmbH acts an employment agency for permanent roles and an employment business for temporary roles.




The salary advertised is the bracket available for this position. The actual salary paid will be dependent on your level of experience, qualifications and skill set. We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitable candidates.

Title: Staff Data Analyst - Digital Tracking (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure, data models, and how this data should be consumed efficiently will ensure your impact across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You‚Äôll Do


Accountable for your teams‚Äô data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the ‚Äúso-whats‚Äù of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Experience with digital tracking and tag management in a B2C environment
Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.




We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.




Responsibilities




Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.




Required Skills




5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
Previous experience with AB testing
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Desirable Skills




Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Show more
HTML:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)


As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.


We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.


Responsibilities


  • Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
  • Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
  • Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
  • Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
  • Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
  • Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
  • Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
  • Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.


Required Skills


  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
  • Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
  • Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
  • Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
  • Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
  • Previous experience with AB testing
  • Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
  • Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
  • Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


Desirable Skills


  • Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
  • Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
  • Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
  • An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Digital Turbine, we make mobile advertising experiences more meaningful and rewarding for users, app publishers, and advertisers ‚Äî intelligently connecting people in more ways, across more devices. We provide app publishers and advertisers with powerful ads and experiences that captivate consumers, fuel performance, and help telecoms and OEMs supercharge awareness, acquisition, and monetization. In a rapidly evolving industry, we are constantly innovating and creating better paths of discovery to connect consumers, publishers, and advertisers across the mobile ecosystem.

About the Role:


Create highly scalable and fault tolerant technical designs working with team members (up to 5 people).
Develop and implement data pipelines that extracts, transforms and loads data into an information product that helps to inform the organization in reaching strategic goals.
Write high-quality code, conduct and participate in code reviews, and follow strong engineering principles and standards.
Research the technical feasibility of new ideas and actively suggest technology improvements.
Quickly develop a thorough understanding of the product, architecting the system and shipping production ready code.
Write maintainable code that can scale fast.
Support and contribute to our amazing work culture.


About You:


Deep experience & understanding of object-oriented design, design patterns, micro services architecture, data structure, algorithms and their complexities, and systems architecture
Skilled in writing and automating tests for your code
Proven working experience with cloud platforms.
Demonstrated experience with OLTP databases, specifically MySQL (understanding of day to day challenges related to query execution and optimization, e.g. indexing and cascading)
Working experience with big data aggregation frameworks (Spark)
Experience with streaming platforms like kafka and rabbitMQ
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience with C++ or any front-end framework is a plus
Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English


Big Data Skills:


3+ years of experience with writing code in Scala
Experience with Python, Spark, Airflow
Experience with Scala testing frameworks
Understanding of data-warehousing and data-modeling techniques
Proven experience with writing code for spark data processing
Familiarity with various OLAP data stores (Druid, Clickhouse etc) and their insights
Experience with at least one columnar OLAP databases
Familiarity with industry-standard analytics and visualization tools

Description:
Die Verti Versicherung AG ist Deutschlands zweitgr√∂√üter Kfz-Direktversicherer. Das 1996 gegr√ºndete Unternehmen z√§hlt mehr als eine Million Bestandspolicen. Verti besch√§ftigt etwa 500 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter am Hauptfirmensitz in Teltow bei Berlin sowie am 2018 neu gegr√ºndeten Standort in Vaterstetten bei M√ºnchen. Verti ist seit 2015 Teil der MAPFRE Gruppe und firmierte bis 2017 als Direct Line. Ausgehend vom Pr√§mienvolumen ist MAPFRE unter den Top 15 der gr√∂√üten Versicherungsgruppen in Europa. Verti ist die weltweite Digitalmarke von MAPFRE. Seit 2018 ist Verti Namensgeber einer der modernsten Veranstaltungsst√§tten Europas: der Verti Music Hall in Berlin.

Um unseren Kunden passgenaue Produkte und einen bestm√∂glichen Service anbieten zu k√∂nnen, ist die Analyse und Interpretation von Daten essentiell. Als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) im Bereich Clients bei Verti liegt Dein Fokus auf der Datenaufbereitung und -analyse unserer Bestandskundendaten. Ziel ist es, unsere Kunden noch zielgruppengerechter anzusprechen und dadurch st√§rker an uns zu binden. Die Interaktion und der l√∂sungsorientierte Austausch im eigenen Team aber vor allem auch mit anderen datengetriebenen Unternehmensbereichen ist uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nutze die M√∂glichkeit, Deine Expertise erfolgreich einzubringen und Analysen zu erarbeiten, die Grundlage f√ºr richtungsweisende Entscheidungen bei Verti sein k√∂nnen. Werde Teil unseres dynamischen und multikulturellen Clients Bereichs.

Verti ist auf Wachstumskurs und sucht Dich zur Verst√§rkung als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Teltow bei Berlin.

Die Position ist in Vollzeit zu besetzen.

Aufgaben


Extrahierung von Bestandskunden-Daten, Durchf√ºhrung von komplexen Datenanalysen und Erarbeitung von Prognosemodellen zur L√∂sung datengetriebener Fragestellungen und zur Generierung von Customer Insights entlang der gesamten Customer Journey
Definition von Zielstellungen f√ºr die bestandserhalt- oder kundenwertf√∂rdernden Aktionen gemeinsam mit dem CRM-Team
Evaluierung der Erreichung der genannten Ziele im Erfolgsmonitoring
Aufbereitung von aussagekr√§ftigen Dashboards zur kontinuierlichen Erfolgskontrolle und √úberwachung der Entwicklung der relevanten Customer KPIs

Schnittstelle zu anderen datenverarbeitenden Bereichen im Unternehmen wie dem Data Warehouse, Versicherungsmathematik oder Data & Analytics


Profil


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit relevantem Schwerpunkt (Betriebswirtschaft, Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik etc.) oder eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung mit entsprechender Weiterbildung
Relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data/ Customer Analytics
Idealerweise erste Berufserfahrung im versicherungsmathematischen Bereich, Erfahrungen im Umfeld der Kfz- und Sachversicherung
Erfahrung im Umgang mit SQL-basierten Anwendungen und Statistiitkprogrammen, Sicherer Umgang mit den g√§ngigen MS Office-Anwendungen
Deutschkenntnisse mind. Level C1, sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
Sehr gutes analytisches Denkverm√∂gen, schnelle Auffassungsgabe, selbstst√§ndige, ergebnisorientierte sowie proaktive Arbeitsweise
F√§higkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen klar und verst√§ndlich zu visualisieren und zu kommunizieren
Sicheres Auftreten, Durchsetzungsf√§higkeit und gute Pr√§sentationsf√§higkeiten
Arbeitserlaubnis der Europ√§ischen Union


Wir bieten

Arbeiten und Wohlf√ºhlen: Du sollst Dich bei uns wohlf√ºhlen und erfolgreich sein k√∂nnen. Daf√ºr bieten wir Dir beste Rahmenbedingungen:


Einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag mit einem Jahresurlaubsanspruch von 30 Tagen plus Betriebsferien am 24. und 31. Dezember
39-Stundenwoche
Vielf√§ltige Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeiten und Karrierechancen
Flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie die M√∂glichkeit zum mobilen Arbeiten
Diverses Kollegium in einem internationalen Konzernumfeld
Professionelles Onboarding
Moderner und ergonomisch gestalteter Arbeitsplatz
Subventionierte Kantine mit Kaffeebar
Firmeneigenes Fitnessstudio sowie diverse Sport- und Gesundheitsangebote (u.a. kostenfreier Yoga-Unterricht, Massage- und Physiotherapieangebot, Tischtennisplatte)
Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte
Teamevents wie z.B. Teilnahme an Laufveranstaltungen, regelm√§√üige Volunteering-Aktivit√§ten, Betriebsfeiern, etc.
Anspruch auf einen Sozialtag pro Jahr zur Aus√ºbung des privaten, ehrenamtlichen Engagements


‚Ä¶ und nat√ºrlich die vielen tollen Kolleginnen und Kollegen im #TeamVerti

Lokal und Global: Bei uns kannst Du Dich je nach Aufgabengebiet in internationale Projekte einbringen und in internationalen Teams innerhalb des MAPFRE-Konzerns arbeiten.

Innovation und Expertise: Ein Umfeld, in dem innovative, digitale Ideen wie in einem Start-up vorangetrieben werden - mit der Expertise aus mehr als 25 Jahren Erfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche.

Vielfalt und Nachhaltigkeit: Als Unterzeichner der Charta der Vielfalt stehen wir f√ºr Diversit√§t und Gerechtigkeit am Arbeitsplatz. Gender Pay Gap? Nicht bei Verti! Ebenso hat bei uns der verantwortungsvolle Umgang mit Ressourcen einen hohen Stellenwert. Aktuell fokussieren wir uns darauf bis 2024 klimaneutral zu werden.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

  • Relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data/ Customer Analytics
  • Idealerweise erste Berufserfahrung im versicherungsmathematischen Bereich, Erfahrungen im Umfeld der Kfz- und Sachversicherung
  • Erfahrung im Umgang mit SQL-basierten Anwendungen und Statistiitkprogrammen, Sicherer Umgang mit den g√§ngigen MS Office-Anwendungen
  • Deutschkenntnisse mind. Level C1, sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
  • Sehr gutes analytisches Denkverm√∂gen, schnelle Auffassungsgabe, selbstst√§ndige, ergebnisorientierte sowie proaktive Arbeitsweise
  • F√§higkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen klar und verst√§ndlich zu visualisieren und zu kommunizieren
  • Sicheres Auftreten, Durchsetzungsf√§higkeit und gute Pr√§sentationsf√§higkeiten
  • Arbeitserlaubnis der Europ√§ischen Union

Wir bieten

Arbeiten und Wohlf√ºhlen: Du sollst Dich bei uns wohlf√ºhlen und erfolgreich sein k√∂nnen. Daf√ºr bieten wir Dir beste Rahmenbedingungen:

  • Einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag mit einem Jahresurlaubsanspruch von 30 Tagen plus Betriebsferien am 24. und 31. Dezember
  • 39-Stundenwoche
  • Vielf√§ltige Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeiten und Karrierechancen
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie die M√∂glichkeit zum mobilen Arbeiten
  • Diverses Kollegium in einem internationalen Konzernumfeld
  • Professionelles Onboarding
  • Moderner und ergonomisch gestalteter Arbeitsplatz
  • Subventionierte Kantine mit Kaffeebar
  • Firmeneigenes Fitnessstudio sowie diverse Sport- und Gesundheitsangebote (u.a. kostenfreier Yoga-Unterricht, Massage- und Physiotherapieangebot, Tischtennisplatte)
  • Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte
  • Teamevents wie z.B. Teilnahme an Laufveranstaltungen, regelm√§√üige Volunteering-Aktivit√§ten, Betriebsfeiern, etc.
  • Anspruch auf einen Sozialtag pro Jahr zur Aus√ºbung des privaten, ehrenamtlichen Engagements

‚Ä¶ und nat√ºrlich die vielen tollen Kolleginnen und Kollegen im #TeamVerti

Lokal und Global: Bei uns kannst Du Dich je nach Aufgabengebiet in internationale Projekte einbringen und in internationalen Teams innerhalb des MAPFRE-Konzerns arbeiten.

Innovation und Expertise: Ein Umfeld, in dem innovative, digitale Ideen wie in einem Start-up vorangetrieben werden - mit der Expertise aus mehr als 25 Jahren Erfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche.

Vielfalt und Nachhaltigkeit: Als Unterzeichner der Charta der Vielfalt stehen wir f√ºr Diversit√§t und Gerechtigkeit am Arbeitsplatz. Gender Pay Gap? Nicht bei Verti! Ebenso hat bei uns der verantwortungsvolle Umgang mit Ressourcen einen hohen Stellenwert. Aktuell fokussieren wir uns darauf bis 2024 klimaneutral zu werden.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Referrals (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Referrals Analytics team, you'll play a key role in the Global Virality department. This team works on getting customers to share their HelloFresh experiences and recommend us to their friends. We aim to build a flexible referral program offering attractive deals to customers across the HelloFresh Group. The team is a hyper growth team which contribute to ~30% of the overall business globally.

In this job, you‚Äôll provide important insights that help shape our Digital Product and Commercial strategies. You'll use data to spot trends and find new opportunities that guide our decisions. You'll also help create a data-driven culture in our team, making sure everyone can use data to make smart choices. Your skills in Data Analytics and related technologies, along with your strong communication and organizational abilities, will greatly influence our company‚Äôs success.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize campaign targeting and efficiency of referral program promotions to customers
Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Creating deep-dives and ad-hoc analysis, research, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilize various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Virality Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.


What You‚Äôll Bring


4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if you‚Äôve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

Title: IIoT & Business Data Analyst for FactoryPal (m/f/d)
Description:
You want to redefine how entire industries work by leveraging IoT, Smart Manufacturing and Industry 4.0? Would you like to be part of the success of a digital solution which will revolutionize the manufacturing process to improve shop floor performance? If your answer is a big yes, you should continue reading!

With HQ in Berlin, FactoryPal is a corporate Start-Up ‚Äì with an additional location in Porto/Portugal. The venture is poised to become the leading end-to-end IoT solution for machine efficiency and equipment effectiveness. The digitally enabled solution is not just completely reshaping how companies produce and elevate their efficiency levels, but it is fundamentally augmenting the way manufacturing employees do their job.

We are data scientists, engineers, designers, IIoT experts, product managers, and manufacturing operations consultants. We are a team, united by our shared ambition: revolutionize manufacturing and transform the way it is done to ensure smooth operations.

Become part of an amazing journey and successfully accompany our customers in their Digital Factory efforts!

Your Role & Key Responsibilities as a IIoT & Business Data Analyst

Joining our customer value analytics team as a data analyst means you'll be an essential part of further developing FactoryPal's analytics product. Together with our experienced data analysts, you'll work on the following topics:


Data Transformation and Analysis:

Generate key insights into customer data by extracting, cleaning, and transforming data from our Snowflake data warehouse using dbt.
Create and maintain data pipelines to ensure accurate and timely data delivery.
Explore large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies to tell stories with data.



Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting:

Work with Tableau to create insightful reports and dashboards.
Visualize complex data in a user-friendly manner, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver actionable insights.



Stakeholder Management & Product Development

Understand and identify the analysis and reporting needs of key customer contacts and internal stakeholders
Derive and communicate insights into customers‚Äô machine and business data.
Contribute with your experience to our product development process and thereby enhance FactoryPal‚Äôs analytics solution.


Your Experience & Skills


Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Industrial Engineering, STEM or related fields)
>2 years experience in data analysis, modeling and reporting in a relevant environment - ideally in the industrial / manufacturing sector
Strong analytical mindset and a passion for working with data
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases (first experience with dbt is a plus)
Solid knowledge of Python for data analytics
Experience with Business Intelligence Tools (ideally Tableau)
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) for managing code and collaboration
Ideally first experience in development of an analytics product using agile methods
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively within our team
Willingness to take ownership of tasks and seek solutions independently
Your English is fluent


What You Get


Opportunity to work in a well-funded corporate Start-Up with a competitive advantage derived from market access.
Exposure to the hottest IT technologies, like AI/ML, Cloud and Industrial IoT
Challenging role with lots of opportunities to grow fast & steadily - as an expert and as an entrepreneur
Development opportunity in a group of professionals, who joined from top tier start-up, industry and consulting companies and an education from top tier universities
Offices in prime working locations and technology hotspots such as Berlin and Porto.
Hands-On shopfloor experience in the manufacturing environment with travel opportunities - local and global.
An agile, inspiring, multi-cultural, multi-disciplinary and innovative work environment.
A competitive salary & benefits package - incl. 30 days vacation and dedicated training budget.


Are you interested?

Join our team and send us your detailed application documents via the "Apply" button.

Title: Data Excellence Senior Associate (x/f/m)
Description:
What You‚Äôll Do

Doctolib is looking for a Data excellence senior associate to strengthen the newly created HCP (Healthcare Practitioners) Data Platform team.

Your main missions will be to :


Maximize our Prospects Target addressable market to enable Sales & Marketing growth
Improve our database quality
Join forces with our product and ops teams to scale our processes



As a Data excellence senior associate, you will be the main point of contact of our local sales & marketing teams based in France, Germany and Italy.

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Be the main point of contact regarding prospect data :


Work with all business teams to propose the right governance & business processes to ensure our data standards (eg. Sales, Marketing, Finance, Legal, Products‚Ä¶)
Propose ambitious roadmaps to achieve our goals



Lead complex data excellence projects:


Lead, scope, drive & deliver data excellence projects (data analysis, data strategy, quality, data sourcing, Sales processes & change management, etc.)
Build scalable & lasting solutions by yourself or via our internal partners (Data Analytics, Data Operations, Product teams)
Ensure our database is efficient, complete & accurate and provide market knowledge on our prospect & competitors (Salesforces, MDM)



Who You Are

If you don‚Äôt meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply!

You could be our next team mate if you:


You have at least 3 to 5 years of experience as a consultant, business or data analyst with strong business & data sense. You also have a fast and successful track record in a B2B SaaS company or consulting firm;
You‚Äôre highly proficient in writing SQL queries, including complex joins, and have extensive experience working with large databases.;
You have experience in leading projects
English is mandatory, French / German / Italian are a plus.



Now, it would be fantastic if you have:


Python knowledge & development experience
Experience with CRM (e.g. Salesforces) or MDM (Reltio)



Was wir Dir bieten


ein Aktienoptionsprogramm f√ºr alle Doctoliber
eine betriebliche Krankenversicherung mit tollen Zusatzleistungen
Viertelj√§hrlicher (oder monatlicher Bonus) und ein kompetitives Gehaltspaket
28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zus√§tzlich f√ºr jedes volle Besch√§ftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat) uvm. enth√§lt
Solidarity Days: 2 Tage pro Jahr, um Wohlt√§tigkeitsorganisationen im Gesundheitswesen zu unterst√ºtzen
Mentales Wohlbefinden durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit externen Partnern
Ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, das hybrides- und B√ºro-basiertes Arbeiten erm√∂glicht
Flexibility Days: 10 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland oder UK arbeiten
Erstattung der √ñPNV-Kosten oder Firmenwagen (nur f√ºr den Field Sales)
Verpflegung Budget und gesunde Snacks im B√ºro
Ein gef√∂rdertes Sportangebot mit unserem Partner Urban Sports Club



The interview process


HR screen interview
Hiring Manager Interview
Case study + Case Restitution
At least one reference check



Job details


Permanent position
Full Time
Workplace : Berlin
Start date : ASAP
Remuneration : fix + bonus on objectives (according to your profile)



A stock options plan for every Doctoliber

At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone - regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it!

The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin.
