Title: Product Analyst (WoT Blitz)
Description:
Job Overview

World of Tanks Blitz is one of the most famous mobile action games. Over almost 10 years of operation, our game has engaged more than 200 million users and has been published on 6 different platforms. Every month we add hundreds of new goods to our store and launch dozens of activities. In order to help the team evaluate their results, we are looking for a person who is passionate about both Data Analytics and Monetization.




What will you do?

Close collaboration with key product stakeholders for generating product hypotheses for subsequent validation.
Evaluation of the results of LiveOps activities: gameplay and monetization events.
Development of Tableau dashboards for monitoring various product metrics.
Statistical analysis of data and preparation of reports based on its results.
Data extraction upon request and automation of data transformation processes.




What are we looking for?

3+ year experience on a similar position
Understanding of main product metrics and the ability to craft custom metrics based on business requests.
Fluency with SQL
Experience with Tableau/Looker/Power BI
Good understanding of statistics




What additional skills will help you stand out?

Good written English
Experience with Python and popular libraries for data manipulation and analysis
Understanding of ETL process




Benefits

Benefits and perks are tailored to the local market and culture. Our benefits in Berlin include:

Career development and education opportunities within the company
Home internet reimbursement
Gym membership through Urban Sports Club - Package M
Mental well-being program (iFeel)
Language classes
Company pension scheme with a company contribution up to 150 EUR per month
Personal Gaming Account
Coffee, fruits, and snacks in the office
Company events
Seniority Awards
Referral program - You can recommend the best talents to the company and receive a reward

Description:
WAS DU BEI UNS MACHST

Du hast eine analytische Denkweise und ein hohes Ma√ü an Probleml√∂sungskompetenz.

Einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag mit einem attraktiven Gehalt in einem jungen, stabilen und zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen.
Innovative Unternehmenskultur: Hier kannst Du unser Unternehmen kennenlernen: ista Express Service Mediathek (https://www.ista-express.de/videos/).

Spannende und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Raum f√ºr eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten.

Mitarbeiterrabatte bei √ºber 800 Anbietern wie Zalando, Adidas, Apple & Co - da ist bestimmt auch f√ºr Dich etwas dabei!
Mitarbeiter werben Mitarbeiter: Pr√§mie.
Extras: Auf Dich warten neben einem Siebtr√§ger-Coffeemaker, Obstkorb und kostenlosen Getr√§nken auch viele weitere Extras (z.B. Firmenevents, Gewinnspiele).


DU HAST NOCH FRAGEN?

Wir beantworten Dir gerne Fragen zum Bewerbungsablauf f√ºr die Position als Data Engineer (m/w/d). Melde Dich einfach per Telefon unter +49 341 69700777.

√úber uns

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Commercial & Marketplace)
Description:
Open in all locations: France, Germany, the Netherlands, and the United Kingdom




At Instapro, we are revolutionising the way people engage with our marketplace by connecting homeowners and tradespeople in a dynamic and efficient ecosystem. We are seeking a talented Senior Analyst to join our Commercial & Analytics team and drive strategic marketplace & pricing decisions that optimise value for our customers.




As a Senior Analyst for our two-sided marketplace product, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our marketplace strategy and maximizing revenue growth. You will lead the development of pricing models & marketplace/revenue initiatives, and partner closely with teams across the organisation to ensure successful execution. Your ability to blend quantitative analysis with strategic thinking will be instrumental in achieving our business objectives.




This role reports into the Strategic Analytics Lead, Commercial and Analytics Team, which operates across all brands and geographies. The role can be based out of any of our 4 office locations: Aix-en-Provence, Amsterdam, Berlin and London.




Your role includes the following:

Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions
Collaborate with broader marketing teams to develop and implement strategic initiatives that drive revenue/LTV growth and market expansion
Develop and maintain comprehensive reports, dashboards, and visualizations to track key performance indicators (KPIs) that guide marketplace health
Formulate A/B test frameworks to discern the impact of adjustments/new initiatives on marketplace & other business metrics
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance data accuracy, reporting efficiency, and overall analytical capabilities. Leverage advanced analytical tools and technologies to optimize workflows
Work closely with cross-functional teams including Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Operations to ensure alignment of commercial strategies with overall business objectives
Develop and deliver clear, actionable recommendations to senior leadership, accompanied by data-driven insights and rationale
Stay informed about industry best practices, emerging pricing trends, and technological advancements to continuously improve marketplace growth




Job requirements:

6+ years of professional experience as an analyst/senior analyst, preferably in a two-sided marketplace
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Business or a related field, with a strong analytical background
Demonstrated capability to influence stakeholders and manage projects from strategy development through to successful execution
Proficiency in data analysis & reporting tools (e.g.Tableau, Looker, and BigQuery/SQL, among others)
Strong analytical skills and good at interpreting data, generating qualitative feedback and evaluating metrics to inform decision-making
Good business acumen with a strong understanding of commercial topics
Exceptional organisational skills, capable of managing multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
Experience in campaign management in a customer centric environment is a plus
Fluent in English, with strong verbal and written communication skills




Why you‚Äôll enjoy working at the Instapro Group

You can make an Impact. Joining Instapro Group is an opportunity to help crack the code in one of the last big industries to become digital-first. We‚Äôre leaders in our markets, yet small enough for everyone to make a real difference.

We care. We don‚Äôt believe in one size fits all. Whether it‚Äôs flexibility in your working hours, your location, or opportunities to advance and grow, you‚Äôll find a supportive and open culture designed to help our team members thrive.




These are the benefits you'll enjoy:

Highly competitive salary package
Hybrid work environment
Hybrid allowance/benefit
Eligibility to receive an equity award
Temporary work from abroad policy
Mental health support
Regular team and social events
Further benefits depending on location




These are the values that guide everything we do:

We put integrity first. We are authentic, transparent and respectful.
We are all stewards. We are stewards of the company on behalf of all stakeholders.
We follow the evidence. We are objective, evidence-based and pragmatic in our decision-making.
We never stop learning. We are open-minded and curious.
We win together. We collaborate and earn trust with our colleagues.
We are inclusive. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company.

Read our values in full here




Interested in applying? Submit your application below and we will get back to you.

Title: Data Analyst Salesforce Data Cloud - Marketing (all genders)
Description:
Wir geh√∂ren zu den Top-Adressen in der IT-Welt und fokussieren uns auf die Optimierung der Kerngesch√§fts¬≠prozesse unserer Kunden. Durch den smarten Einsatz ma√ügeschneiderter IT-L√∂sungen unterst√ºtzen wir unsere Kunden dabei, das Beste aus ihrem Business und aktuellen Technologien herauszuholen. Berlin, K√∂ln, D√ºsseldorf, Hamburg, Dortmund, Frankfurt, Leipzig, M√ºnchen, Jena

DEINE ROLLE - DAS WARTET AUF DICH

Bist du bereit, die Marketingstrategien unserer Kunden durch datengetriebene Einsichten neu zu definieren? Au√üerdem zeichnet dich eine starke L√∂sungsorientierung aus? Dann bist du bei adesso genau richtig!

In deiner Rolle als Data Analyst spielst du eine zentrale Rolle bei der Einf√ºhrung der Salesforce Data Cloud bei unseren Kunden.

Kundenberatung und Datenanalyse: Du ber√§tst Kunden bei der Einf√ºhrung der Salesforce Data Cloud und identifizierst durch die Analyse vorhandener Kundendaten datengetriebene Marketing-Use Cases.
Kundendatenstrategie und Implementierung: Du entwickelst in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden eine umfassende Kundendatenstrategie, die auf den identifizierten Use Cases basiert, und bist f√ºr die Implementierung des Datenmodells in der Salesforce Data Cloud verantwortlich.
Technische Integration und Segmentierung: Du gew√§hrleistest eine optimale Verkn√ºpfung von Business-Anforderungen mit technischen Datenmodellen und erstellst technische Segmente, um spezifische Marketing-Use Cases zu unterst√ºtzen.
Presales und Projektverantwortung: Du unterst√ºtzt Presales-Aktivit√§ten, erstellst Pitch-Konzepte und pr√§sentierst diese vor potenziellen Kunden. Zudem √ºbernimmst du die Verantwortung f√ºr die erfolgreiche Umsetzung und Implementierung der Projekte im Auftrag unserer Kunden.


DEINE SKILLS - DAS BRINGST DU MIT


Erfahrung: Du bringst mehrj√§hrige Erfahrung als Data Analyst mit, idealerweise in Digital Analytics oder Marketing Analytics. Erfahrungen mit Verhaltensdaten im Digitalbereich oder Customer Data im Marketing sind w√ºnschenswert.
Kenntnisse in Datenplattformen: Du hast Kenntnisse in Customer Data Platforms, Kenntnisse der Salesforce Data Cloud sind ein zus√§tzlicher Vorteil.
Digitales Marketing und Analytische F√§higkeiten: Du besitzt ein fundiertes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr digitales Marketing und bist erfahren in der Analyse und Interpretation von Daten sowie in der Identifikation von datengetriebenen Use Cases.
Kundendatenstrategie und Technische F√§higkeiten: Du hast Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Implementierung von Kundendatenstrategien und verf√ºgst √ºber ein tiefes Verst√§ndnis von relationalen Datenmodellen sowie hervorragende SQL-F√§higkeiten.
Kommunikation und Teamarbeit: Du kannst komplexe technische Inhalte klar vermitteln und arbeitest effektiv sowohl in interdisziplin√§ren Teams als auch selbstst√§ndig.


Unser Versprechen: Du wirst dich bei uns wohlf√ºhlen! Kollegial, famili√§r und auf Augenh√∂he ‚Äì wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Diversit√§t und verschiedene Blickwinkel werden bei uns genauso gesch√§tzt wie du als Mensch. Das und viel mehr steht f√ºr unser ganz besonderes Wir-Gef√ºhl. F√ºr das es sogar ein Wort gibt: adessi.

Unsere Kultur und das Zusammenarbeiten sind gepr√§gt von gegenseitiger Wertsch√§tzung, Anerkennung und Unterst√ºtzung. Das verbindet uns hierarchie√ºbergreifend ‚Äì auch im Home-Office. So belegen wir zum wiederholten Mal den 1. Platz beim Wettbewerb ‚ÄûDeutschlands Beste Arbeitgeber in der ITK‚Äú!. Unser umfangreiches Trainingsangebot und ein transparentes Laufbahnstufenmodell f√ºr alle sorgen daf√ºr, dass deine Entwicklung bei uns nicht stillsteht. Denn gemeinsam zu wachsen und Chancengeber zu sein, das ist programmiert in unserer DNA.

Title: Data Engineer, Business Intelligence
Description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer, Business Intelligence to help make the vast amount of data we produce organized and valuable so everyone in the company can make great decisions through insights. You will work on analytics tools, data quality, reporting solutions, data pipelines, data modeling and more.

About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 80 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Data Platform team is central to our data-driven strategy, designing and developing our data ecosystem, data process processes and analytics capabilities. We work on problems such as product events tracking, AB experiments framework and large-scale applied machine learning. The team is also responsible for making the vast amount of data accessible, reliable and efficient to query, so we are empowered to make the best data-driven decisions. We work with a wide variety of tools and technologies, from Spark to Looker, making this team a great place to learn new skills.

You Will


Work closely with different teams and business partners in the organization, build and foster strong relationships
Develop new data pipelines and work with data analysts, data scientists, engineers and product managers to add new data sources or new views in our data
Implement and maintain data models using analytics tools in order to allow our business users access the data directly and drive decisions
Design and implement metrics, dashboards and reports
Ensure data quality, accuracy and reliability
Empower and train our data users to use data more efficiently, by extending our self serve data services and documentation
Serve as a liaison between the product teams, analytics team and the data engineering team


Who You Are


2-3 years of relevant experience in a business intelligence role, including data warehousing and analytics tools, techniques and technologies
Experience in Data Warehousing solutions (Snowflake, Delta, PostgreSQL, BigQuery)
Expert knowledge with SQL & OLAP
Experience with Python or Scala
Advanced knowledge of data warehousing concepts and schema optimization based on usage patterns
Knowledge and direct experience in data visualization concepts using business intelligence reporting tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Jupyter notebooks)
Experience in developing cross-platform ETL processes, maintaining systems for tracking data quality and consistency and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex data sets
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Experience with big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka, Hive, Hadoop)
Experience with data manipulation tools and libraries (e.g. PySpark, Pandas, R)
Prior experience in start-up environment


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


Show more

  • Experience in Data Warehousing solutions (Snowflake, Delta, PostgreSQL, BigQuery)
  • Expert knowledge with SQL & OLAP
  • Experience with Python or Scala
  • Advanced knowledge of data warehousing concepts and schema optimization based on usage patterns
  • Knowledge and direct experience in data visualization concepts using business intelligence reporting tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Jupyter notebooks)
  • Experience in developing cross-platform ETL processes, maintaining systems for tracking data quality and consistency and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex data sets
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice To Have

  • Experience with big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka, Hive, Hadoop)
  • Experience with data manipulation tools and libraries (e.g. PySpark, Pandas, R)
  • Prior experience in start-up environment

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
  • Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
  • Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
  • Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit √ºber 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 L√§ndern und f√ºhrend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.

Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Gro√üartiges.

Projekte von der Planung und Konzeption bis hin zur Realisierung von (Big) Data Architekturen, Prozessstrecken, Machine Learning und Analytics-L√∂sungen
Optimierung bestehender BI und Big Data Landschaften und Implementierung verschiedenster Datenstrukturen und -prozesse
Schnittstellenfunktion zwischen operativen Fachbereichen und der technischen Entwicklung
Moderne Data Lake Ans√§tze entwickeln, neue Technologien kennenlernen und Kund:innen beim Aufbau von On-Premise, Cloud- & IoT-Architekturen unterst√ºtzen

Abschluss vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, (Wirtschafts-) Mathematik, Statistik, Physik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
Nice-to have: Erfahrung im Umfeld Data Engineering, Data Warehousing, Big Data Architekturen, ETL/ELT, Business Intelligence, Analytics und/oder Data Science
Verhandlungssichere (C1) Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region



Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erf√ºllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert f√ºr die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne dar√ºber sprechen!

Unser Versprechen

Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren F√ºhrungsleits√§tzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung f√∂rdernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz √ºber Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterst√ºtzung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenh√∂he. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchie√ºbergreifend ‚Äì auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung ‚ÄûTOP Company‚Äú.

Das erwartet Dich bei uns:


Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.
Entwicklung: Individuelle F√∂rderung Deiner St√§rken - Regelm√§√üige Feedbackgespr√§che, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.
Work-Life-Balance: Raum f√ºr Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-W√ºrttemberg.
Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere L√∂sungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.
Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.
Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing
Description:
Bumble Inc. is seeking an experienced Marketing Analyst to work with our paid marketing stakeholders, take an integrated ecosystem approach and support critical business decisions across all of our apps. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys the fast paced environment of a growing company, has experience in marketing and has a passion to contribute to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have an extensive background in marketing analytics at an app based tech company, with proven experience of driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical business problems.¬†

You bring experience of working with complex sources of both Brand and Paid Marketing data and use that knowledge to partner with stakeholders and senior leaders, taking a holistic approach to find answers. You are comfortable challenging priorities and communicating analytical roadmaps.

You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Remaining laser-focused on the "so what" of the findings, and how the insights support business decisions you take an integrated perspective to analytics, considers all the potential drivers to a problem, reviewing existing knowledge and bringing in expertise for advice from other teams.

You enjoy efficiently producing insights that inform decision-making as well as providing support for an extensive experimentation program. Passionate about continual improvement, both personally and for the team around you, you always look for feedback to strive for higher quality of deliverables.




KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
You will build and deliver analytical roadmaps to support the longer term vision of marketing measurement within the business. This includes reporting, handling of ad-hoc requests and data visibility, experimentation, and ongoing measurement of marketing campaigns
You will provide insights and recommendations which are actionable and relevant to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where necessary, and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.¬†
You will act as a trusted thought partner as the analytical authority in your domain. You will likely be dedicated to a set of specific initiatives and projects, where you will be expected to act as a representative of the Advanced Data Analytics team, demonstrating our values, capabilities, and competencies.¬†
You will develop a deep knowledge on the marketing domain, becoming the authority on its limitations, as well as measurement possibilities. You will proactively educate stakeholder functions to further democratise this understanding
You will contribute to data quality as it relates to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling
You will build and manage self-serve data products, a knowledge base of insights, and provide direct support, to empower others to fully understand the value of data in their day-to-day work
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions of measurement across a variety of marketing initiatives.¬†





REQUIRED EXPERIENCE & SKILLS
Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome
Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else app based product
You will have had experience setting up experimentation, measurement, and data collection in the marketing domain
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our pricing and promotional strategy.¬†
You understand the concept and complexity of marketing measurement and MMM
You will have deep experience of the marketing domain across multiple tactics, including MMM, Churn, LTV and an understanding of the tooling/vendor landscape and opportunities for automation or introduction of genAi.¬†
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.¬†¬†
3+ years experience in commercial analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.¬†
Strong experience with data engineering and data modelling requirements needed to automate reporting and measurement.¬†





ABOUT YOU
A strong believer in Bumble Inc.‚Äôs brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level.¬†
Deep commercial understanding and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer-led insights
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no when needed.¬†
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others¬†¬†
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow
Strong governance and data quality mindset
Understands and can demonstrate machine learning and advanced analytical marketing impact in an organisation.¬†





Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Operations
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc.

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).

Bumble Inc. is seeking an experienced Data Analyst, Operations to work with stakeholders across Member Operations and Trust & Safety. The Operations Analytics team is responsible for all metrics related to operations efficiency, cost, and longevity. It provides support with the analytical, data science, and analytics engineering capabilities required to scale reporting, forecasting, and insights around member retention, workforce management, and operational efficiency.

This is a unique opportunity for an analyst who enjoys a dynamic environment of a growing company, has experience in operational analytics and has a passion to make a positive impact on customers and the business whilst contributing to the Bumble Inc.‚Äôs mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have an extensive background in operations analytics at a relevant tech company, with proven experience of driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical business problems.

You bring experience of working with complex sources of customer operations, payments and behavioural data. You will be fluent in a range of analytical techniques from data modelling, self-serve analytics, to data science and forecasting as applied to workforce management, abuse moderation, and regulatory reporting, and will have a deep understanding of operations and moderation.

You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Key Accountabilities


Collaborate with the member operations and trust and safety teams to generate actionable and pragmatic insights and recommendations, automating decision-making where necessary, and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
Efficiently present your information to executive stakeholders, effectively select the right visualisation types and abstract technical complexities in accessible business language.
Drive core business insights around cost to serve, average handling time, and other operational efficiencies. Design and build reporting suites relevant to the operational stakeholders using multiple domain areas across cost, operations, and business metrics.
Act as a trusted thought partner in the customer operations domain and collaborate with other areas of analytics and the business to bring to light how product and other customer initiatives impact the member support and trust and safety and vice versa.
You will act as translator between business and analyst requirements and applications to the data model.
You will optimise reporting to reflect consistency in sources of truth, and align stakeholders in your domain on definitions of metrics and dimensions.
You will work closely with your team and stakeholders in operations and trust and safety domain to support them with the most impactful priorities, reduce time to insight, ensure data quality and reliability.
You will work with advanced analytics models and methods across the core levers of operations (including experimentation, ML and automation).


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else financial services/high-data-volume industries.
3+ years experience in commercial/operational analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.
You have experience and knowledge of the operations domain across multiple channels, tools, and understand the tooling/vendor landscape (Zendesk, UnitQ among others) and opportunities for automation introduction of genAi.
You have had experience setting up experimentation (A/B testing), measurement, and data collection.
You have experience in building and deploying ML and statistical models for demand forecasting and segmentation.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
Strong experience with data engineering and data modelling requirements needed to automate reporting and measurement.
You have worked with multiple data visualisation and transformation tools, with preference for DBT, Airflow, Fivetran, and Tableau/Powerbi/Looker or similar.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.‚Äôs brand vision and values.
Engaging , inspiring and clear communicator.
A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level.
Deep commercial understanding, and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no where needed.
You can manipulate large datasets, combining data from multiple sources to obtain the required results.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with Python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.You are an expert in SQL and Python and are willing to upskill teams on best practices.
You can break down and explain complex processes, requirements and data pipelines to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You‚Äôll have demonstrable experience in presenting these solutions to your peers.


About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz and Official. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through kind connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble BFF) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Fruitz, founded in 2017, encourages open and honest communication of dating intentions through playful fruit metaphors. Official is an app for couples that promotes open and honest communication between partners and was founded in 2020.
Show more
HTML:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc.

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).

Bumble Inc. is seeking an experienced Data Analyst, Operations to work with stakeholders across Member Operations and Trust & Safety. The Operations Analytics team is responsible for all metrics related to operations efficiency, cost, and longevity. It provides support with the analytical, data science, and analytics engineering capabilities required to scale reporting, forecasting, and insights around member retention, workforce management, and operational efficiency.

This is a unique opportunity for an analyst who enjoys a dynamic environment of a growing company, has experience in operational analytics and has a passion to make a positive impact on customers and the business whilst contributing to the Bumble Inc.‚Äôs mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have an extensive background in operations analytics at a relevant tech company, with proven experience of driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical business problems.

You bring experience of working with complex sources of customer operations, payments and behavioural data. You will be fluent in a range of analytical techniques from data modelling, self-serve analytics, to data science and forecasting as applied to workforce management, abuse moderation, and regulatory reporting, and will have a deep understanding of operations and moderation.

You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Key Accountabilities

  • Collaborate with the member operations and trust and safety teams to generate actionable and pragmatic insights and recommendations, automating decision-making where necessary, and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
  • Efficiently present your information to executive stakeholders, effectively select the right visualisation types and abstract technical complexities in accessible business language.
  • Drive core business insights around cost to serve, average handling time, and other operational efficiencies. Design and build reporting suites relevant to the operational stakeholders using multiple domain areas across cost, operations, and business metrics.
  • Act as a trusted thought partner in the customer operations domain and collaborate with other areas of analytics and the business to bring to light how product and other customer initiatives impact the member support and trust and safety and vice versa.
  • You will act as translator between business and analyst requirements and applications to the data model.
  • You will optimise reporting to reflect consistency in sources of truth, and align stakeholders in your domain on definitions of metrics and dimensions.
  • You will work closely with your team and stakeholders in operations and trust and safety domain to support them with the most impactful priorities, reduce time to insight, ensure data quality and reliability.
  • You will work with advanced analytics models and methods across the core levers of operations (including experimentation, ML and automation).

Required Experience & Skills

  • Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
  • Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else financial services/high-data-volume industries.
  • 3+ years experience in commercial/operational analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.
  • You have experience and knowledge of the operations domain across multiple channels, tools, and understand the tooling/vendor landscape (Zendesk, UnitQ among others) and opportunities for automation introduction of genAi.
  • You have had experience setting up experimentation (A/B testing), measurement, and data collection.
  • You have experience in building and deploying ML and statistical models for demand forecasting and segmentation.
  • You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
  • Strong experience with data engineering and data modelling requirements needed to automate reporting and measurement.
  • You have worked with multiple data visualisation and transformation tools, with preference for DBT, Airflow, Fivetran, and Tableau/Powerbi/Looker or similar.

About You

  • Strong believer in Bumble Inc.‚Äôs brand vision and values.
  • Engaging , inspiring and clear communicator.
  • A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level.
  • Deep commercial understanding, and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer led insights.
  • Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no where needed.
  • You can manipulate large datasets, combining data from multiple sources to obtain the required results.
  • A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
  • Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
  • Strong experience with Python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
  • Strong governance and data quality mindset.You are an expert in SQL and Python and are willing to upskill teams on best practices.
  • You can break down and explain complex processes, requirements and data pipelines to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • You‚Äôll have demonstrable experience in presenting these solutions to your peers.

About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz and Official. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through kind connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble BFF) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Fruitz, founded in 2017, encourages open and honest communication of dating intentions through playful fruit metaphors. Official is an app for couples that promotes open and honest communication between partners and was founded in 2020.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

A leading company in the CBD industry is seeking a passionate and motivated Junior Data Analyst to join their innovative team in Central London. This organisation is dedicated to delivering comprehensive CBD products and services, emphasizing sustainable, natural, and organic solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Market Research: Conduct thorough market research to gather and analyze data on industry trends, consumer behavior, and competitive landscape.
Data Analytics: Perform data collection, cleansing, and analysis to generate actionable insights. Utilize statistical tools and software to interpret complex data sets.
Direct Reporting: Act as a direct report to senior team members, providing accurate and timely data analysis and insights.
Presentation Work: Prepare and deliver clear, concise, and compelling presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, R, Python, or SQL.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organisational skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
Prior experience in market research or data analytics is a plus.




This position would suit someone who is a recent graduate from a top-tier university with an environmental data background. To apply for this position, please apply with your most up to date CV.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Introduction

Working within the Risk Models and Data team, part of the banks' 2LOD Risk function, this role as Data Analyst is to work within the Data Analytics workstream of the team.

This is a great opportunity for an analytics professional to be part of a diverse analytics team and be actively involved in a broad range of initiatives.

Main Responsibilities


Run regular production of MI and ad-hoc requests for data analysis
Support the development of robust data analysis for both ad-hoc and regular management reporting
Support the development of efficient management information (MI) production
Support the resolution of Data Quality issues and the Data Lineage activities of the team
Support the build out of a robust data governance and data quality process within the risk function


Ideal Candidate

Research (by Harvard University) shows that women are particularly likely to second guess themselves and not apply - so if you are worried you don't meet all the criteria, get in touch anyhow and let us do the worrying‚Ä¶


A strong communicator who can collaborate cross-functionally
Have relevant experience working with data analysis within financial services
Ideally you will be degree educated, or equivalent, preferably in a STEM subject
Have an intermediate knowledge of SAS and SQL; and be eager to develop further
Have a good understanding of risk/financial terminology and be interested in developing this knowledge further
Be comfortable working with various MS Excel features such as formulas and pivot tables. Knowledge of Power BI is also desirable; but not mandatory


Company Information

Handelsbanken is a relationship bank with a decentralised way of working, a strong local presence thanks to a nationwide network of branches, and a long-term approach to customer relations. Each Handelsbanken branch operates as a local business enabling it to make decisions at a local level and provide a bespoke service. The focus is always on the need of the individual customer and not on the sale of specific products.

The Bank is deeply committed to embedding good equality and diversity practice into all of our activities. This is so that we are an inclusive, welcoming and inspiring place to work that encourages everyone to apply, regardless of socio-economic background, age, disability, pregnancy and/or parental status, race (including colour, nationality, and ethnic or national origin), veteran status, marital and civil partnership status, religion or belief, sex, gender reassignment or sexual orientation.

Check our Handelsbanken website for further information

At Handelsbanken, we deeply value our unique culture and values including trust in and respect for each individual. We take pride in nurturing a work environment where people flourish, and where they are empowered to take decisions in their areas of expertise. We take a long term perspective in everything we do and want each employee who joins us to build a long terms successful career with the Bank.

What is in it for you?


We have a wide range of learning and development available, empowering and enabling our colleagues to take ownership of their own development.
Competitive Salary and an extensive range of benefits is provided, including private medical insurance, income protection and life assurance
A market-leading pension contribution of 15% paid by the bank, which can be invested in a wide range of funds (including ESG and Shariah funds)


Application next steps

Your journey with us begins once you have submitted your application. One of our Handelsbanken recruiters will be reviewing your details and will later organise a phone conversation if you match the role requirements. If there is a mutual fit, we will extend an invitation for you to participate in an interview.

How can we support you to be your best self? Our Talent Acquisition team will be happy to provide support e.g. if you need additional time to prepare for an interview or you have any requirements for any part of the interview/hiring process ‚Äì just let us know by email uk_talent@careers.handelsbanken.co.uk .

This advert will be live for a minimum of two weeks. However, please note that after the two weeks, the closing date could change at any time depending on the number of responses received.

Title: Data Analyst - TikTok LIVE - London
Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touchpoints to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in STEM (science, technology, engineering, math); Advanced Degrees are preferred
- Python is highly preferred
- Attention to detail

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: CRM Data Analyst, EMEI
Description:
The purpose of the CRM Data Analyst, EMEI role is to contribute to optimizing customer interactions and business growth for the Brand.




The CRM Data Analyst, EMEI will play a crucial role in the Maison to leverage our client data to enhance our customer engagement and ultimately foster loyalty to the Brand.




The successful candidate will analyse client behavioural data, performance metrics, market trends and CRM system performance. They will support on the creation and monitoring of client initiatives to enhance business outcomes and improve client engagement.




They will use this insight to help devise strategies and approaches to target our clients to drive sales and enhance the overall client experience.




This position will partner and collaborate cross functionally, including Retail, Operations, Ecommerce, Product, Communications, Events, Merchandising and Planning and Training functions.




Prior experience in CRM and Luxury Retail is advantageous.




The CRM Analyst, EMEI will report directly to the Planning Director, EMEI with multiple key stakeholder relationships across the region.




Key Responsibilities

Development of CRM Analysis

Assess the need and create new KPIs to be able to allow the teams to learn our customers behaviour

Strategic Analysis: Prepare key analysis for the Brand, including monthly and annual reports for the top management. Utilize BI tools to perform hands-on analysis, delivering customer insights across Retail, ECOM, and Buying & Planning.

Monthly Customer business reports (customer typology & customer category) at various level (region, stores)

Customer behavior analysis with product categories and seasonality

Customer and Transactional cross selling analysis

Reporting and KPIs: Develop custom reporting, dashboards, and identify additional KPIs to drive business decisions.

Close collaboration with central CRM team to contribute in creating centralised reports in powerBI

Create an analytical mindset in the retail and ecommerce teams

Data quality monitoring: Oversee client data for the UK and European region.
Segmentation Optimization: Analyse and challenge existing segmentations.

Analysis of CRM Performance

Collection Launch Support: Provide analytical assistance during collection launches, pop ups and new store openings.

Evaluate the effectiveness of CRM and clientelling campaigns and contribute with ideas for enhancements or improvements.

Customer Insights: Collaborate with Retail and Digital teams to analyse customer behavior and demographics. Identify critical client insights, target groups, and evaluate clientelling, events, and marketing initiatives.

Client Engagement Insights: Support all aspects of Client Engagement by analysing performance, ROI for events, and customer-centric insights.

Skillset

Clear Communication: Translate data research into concise, compelling insights through verbal and visual presentations.
Industry Research: Conduct research on clients and the luxury industry.
Holistic Analysis: Integrate and analyze client data from quantitative and qualitative sources.
Collaboration with Paris HQ: Work with the central team to organise workshops for future reports and any other ad hoc projects to enhance departmental performance.
Creativity and Accuracy: Blend innovative approaches while ensuring report accuracy and consistency.




Attributes

A minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in a similar position
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Excellent command of Power BI
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to travel as needed
Passion for Christian Louboutin and a true ambassador for the brand with strong sense of responsibility
Ideal candidate has work experience in medium sized multinational company or luxury business
Additional language fluency is a plus
Adheres to company policy and confidentiality
Proactively contributes to creating a team atmosphere that is professional, flexible and enjoyable
Exudes a ‚Äúno task is too big or too small‚Äù attitude, with initiative, commitment, reliability, and positivity. Does not accept mediocrity
Versatile; embraces change and is consistently able to develop and adapt to the needs of the business.
Driven to learn and grow
Grasps new concepts quickly, prioritizes efficiently and is organized
Exceptional customer service skills along with transparent and effective interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Strong follow up, follow through and attention to detail to ensure deadlines are met




Our Business:

Christian Louboutin opened his first boutique in Paris in 1992. An artist and craftsman with a true passion for shoes, his designs are unique and instantly recognizable, thanks in part to their signature and now trademarked red lacquered soles. The collections for both men and women combine wit, glamour, elegance and technical proficiency like no other. 2014 welcomed the launched of Christian Louboutin Beaute with its first nail colour, Rouge Louboutin. The collection has continued to diversify since then with the launch of lip in 2015, fragrance in 2016 and more recently a wonderful eye collection in 2017. With an extensive range of collections, Christian Louboutin now counts more than 130 boutiques globally.




Our people are at the heart of our brand. We celebrate individuality and allow the freedom to have responsibility, autonomy and creativity within your role. Our colleagues have in common the passion and dedication to our Brand, and its continued success.




Our Values:

We are down to earth ‚Äì we stand with authenticity, integrity and respect.

We have passion ‚Äì we drive the business with agility and care and we are committed to excellence.

We have happiness in all that we do ‚Äì As a team player, we collaborate with positivity, open-mindedness and fun.

We work with inspiration ‚Äì we envision the future with confidence, creativity and freedom.




If the shoe fits, walk with us‚Ä¶




Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

The Maison Christian Louboutin is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to recruitment practices that do not discriminate against any job applicant because of their race, color, gender, age, nationality, culture(s), religion, sex, physical or mental disability, or age. We believe that a culture of diversity and individuality fosters our core values we listed above. So, if you also share this mindset and these values and you dream of coloring your soles red as part of the Louboutin adventure, please join us!




*Please note:

By submitting your CV and application information to Christian Louboutin UK Ltd for the above role, you hereby consent to be contacted by email and/or by telephone in relation to this recruitment process by the HR, Northern Europe Team.

Christian Louboutin UK Ltd respects your privacy and your desire to understand how your information will be handled and used. For more information on our how we collect, use and store your information, please refer to our Privacy Notice: http://eu.christianlouboutin.com/uk_en/policy

  • Proactively contributes to creating a team atmosphere that is professional, flexible and enjoyable
  • Exudes a ‚Äúno task is too big or too small‚Äù attitude, with initiative, commitment, reliability, and positivity. Does not accept mediocrity
  • Versatile; embraces change and is consistently able to develop and adapt to the needs of the business.
  • Driven to learn and grow
  • Grasps new concepts quickly, prioritizes efficiently and is organized
  • Exceptional customer service skills along with transparent and effective interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Strong follow up, follow through and attention to detail to ensure deadlines are met


Our Business:

Christian Louboutin opened his first boutique in Paris in 1992. An artist and craftsman with a true passion for shoes, his designs are unique and instantly recognizable, thanks in part to their signature and now trademarked red lacquered soles. The collections for both men and women combine wit, glamour, elegance and technical proficiency like no other. 2014 welcomed the launched of Christian Louboutin Beaute with its first nail colour, Rouge Louboutin. The collection has continued to diversify since then with the launch of lip in 2015, fragrance in 2016 and more recently a wonderful eye collection in 2017. With an extensive range of collections, Christian Louboutin now counts more than 130 boutiques globally.


Our people are at the heart of our brand. We celebrate individuality and allow the freedom to have responsibility, autonomy and creativity within your role. Our colleagues have in common the passion and dedication to our Brand, and its continued success.


Our Values:

We are down to earth ‚Äì we stand with authenticity, integrity and respect.

We have passion ‚Äì we drive the business with agility and care and we are committed to excellence.

We have happiness in all that we do ‚Äì As a team player, we collaborate with positivity, open-mindedness and fun.

We work with inspiration ‚Äì we envision the future with confidence, creativity and freedom.


If the shoe fits, walk with us‚Ä¶


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

The Maison Christian Louboutin is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to recruitment practices that do not discriminate against any job applicant because of their race, color, gender, age, nationality, culture(s), religion, sex, physical or mental disability, or age. We believe that a culture of diversity and individuality fosters our core values we listed above. So, if you also share this mindset and these values and you dream of coloring your soles red as part of the Louboutin adventure, please join us!


*Please note:

By submitting your CV and application information to Christian Louboutin UK Ltd for the above role, you hereby consent to be contacted by email and/or by telephone in relation to this recruitment process by the HR, Northern Europe Team.

Christian Louboutin UK Ltd respects your privacy and your desire to understand how your information will be handled and used. For more information on our how we collect, use and store your information, please refer to our Privacy Notice: http://eu.christianlouboutin.com/uk_en/policy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

YouLend is the preferred global embedded financing platform for many of the world's leading e-commerce sites, tech companies and payment services providers such as Amazon, eBay, Shopify, Mollie, Dojo, Paysafe, Just Eat Takeaway and Takepayments. Our software platform and APIs enable our partners to offer flexible financing products, in their desired branding, to their merchant base. With YouLend's AI-driven credit risk assessment solutions, more merchants and SMEs than ever can receive fast, flexible and affordable funding. We operate in 9+ geographies across the UK, EU and the US.

We believe that the future of financial services will be delivered by customer-oriented tech companies that embed financing in their customer journeys, and we are building the solutions that will power that future.

The Role:

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data Team. The person taking on this role will collaborate with stakeholders in other departments to understand and specify problems within the business. You will navigate our data, conduct transformations and provide insight and analysis. From there you will communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders. You will also create new data assets (data models, dashboards, models) to serve recurring requests for information and insight.

Requirements


Quantitative educational background, particularly mathematical methods and statistics
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions and providing support to the business
Highly skilled in SQL and Python
Strong written & verbal communication skills, particularly in being able to translate detailed data work for non-technical stakeholders and drive towards impact for the business



Essential:


Previous experience in the financial services / lending
Experience working with dbt, Snowflake, Metabase and Tableau



Benefits

Why join YouLend?


Award-Winning Workplace: YouLend has been recognised as one of the "Best Places to Work 2024" by the Sunday Times for being a supportive, diverse, and rewarding workplace
Award-Winning Fintech: YouLend has been recognised as a "Top 250 Fintech Worldwide" company by CNBC



We offer comprehensive benefits package that includes:


Stock Options
Private Medical insurance via Vitality
EAP with Health Assured
Enhanced Maternity and Paternity Leave
Modern and sophisticated office space in Central London
Free Gym in office building in Holborn
Subsidised Lunch via Feedr
Deliveroo Allowance if working late in office
Monthly in office Masseuse
Team and Company Socials
Football Power League / Squash Club



Salary Range: ¬£55,000 - 85,000 + 20% annual bonus

At YouLend, we champion diversity and embrace equal opportunity employment practices. Our hiring, transfer, and promotion decisions are exclusively based on qualifications, merit, and business requirements, free from any discrimination based on race, gender, age, disability, religion, nationality, or any other protected basis under applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Purpose

At Travelex, data is at the heart of our relationship with our customers. We analyse data in order to understand what our customers prefer and how our products perform. Our work is fast-paced although our team remains collaborative and flexible even when delivering fast.

Your role as data analyst will be to run a wide range of queries on our datasets, interpret the results, and communicate your findings to colleagues and stakeholders. You will be working with product owners, subject matter experts, managers and engineers across the company to develop deep insight on our customers and products.

You will have an end-to-end responsibility for your deliverables: from leading the work to agree the right approach, through developing, running and continuously refining your queries, all the way to presenting your results and recommending what the business should do about them. You will have significant impact on the way our business evolves, and a high level of freedom to do things in your own way.




Responsibilities

Here are key things you‚Äôll do as a data analyst in our team. The list isn‚Äôt complete: as a competent analyst, you‚Äôll bring to Travelex your own ideas of what else is needed to become a world-class data-driven business.

Work with colleagues to understand their analytical needs and convert these into robust analytical tasks
Explore data in a range of business domains, such as: retail customer behaviour; online customer behaviour; payment cards; product performance; colleague performance; HR; finance, cost and pricing
Analyse data to understand trends, gaps and anomalies
Build time series, models and forecasts
Compare the performance of products, campaigns and sales across the different geographies where Travelex operates
Help automate analytical tasks so that powerful analytics can come with little effort
Present your findings in a simple, compelling and inspiring way
Develop visualisations and infographics that will shed light on complex business questions
Derive metrics from data and build the processes to monitor these metrics over time
Have particular responsibility for data quality: defining it, monitoring it and improving it




Key Requirements

This vacancy is for someone who greatly enjoys problem-solving, simplifying complex data into simple insight, and continuous learning. Below are key requirements from our data analyst, but you don‚Äôt need to tick every box: success in our team comes in many forms!

Competent in analysing data using SQL and Python
Familiar with AWS, including databases, data services and analytics capabilities
Experienced with SageMaker
Capable of creating engaging visualisations and infographics
A strong storyteller, who can turn a big pile of numbers into an interesting narrative
Self-starter and independent, able to turn loosely-defined requirements into concrete deliverables by asking questions, taking initiative and recommending a way forward
A good team player, who enjoys brainstorming and engaging, and is able to resolve differences of opinion in a constructive way
Understands the foundations of information security and data protection
Able to learn new tools, languages and methods quickly
Have the curiosity to understand the business, its requirements and culture
Knowledge of visualisation tools (e.g. Amazon QuickSight) and data modelling techniques isn‚Äôt essential but would be an advantage
Familiarity with DBT would be an advantage
Experience of building machine learning models, and familiarity with the common ML libraries in Python, would be an advantage
Your own unique style or way of working, which will make our team diverse and original




Why Travelex?

To remain the world‚Äôs leading Foreign Exchange specialist, we focus on making our customers‚Äô lives hassle-free while they travel.

We are customer-centric and innovative. Our digital and data products are part of our investment in the future of Foreign Exchange, cross-border e-commerce and international payments.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why work for us?

A career at Janus Henderson is more than a job, it‚Äôs about investing in a brighter future together.

Our Mission at Janus Henderson is to help clients define and achieve superior financial outcomes through differentiated insights, disciplined investments, and world-class service. We will do this by protecting and growing our core business, amplifying our strengths, and diversifying where we have the right.

Our Values are key to driving our success, and are at the heart of everything we do:

Clients Come First - Always | Execution Supersedes Intention | Together We Win | Diversity Improves Results | Truth Builds Trust

If our mission, values, and purpose align with your own, we would love to hear from you!

Your opportunity

To join the Investment Data Strategy & Solutions Team - tasked with leading the data analysis on the components of strategic projects associated with the investment community
The Investment Data Strategy & Solutions Team is part of the Investment Management Chief Operating Officer Office (IM COO) working within Investment Management
Identify and analyse data attributes within JHI (Janus Henderson International) systems and document the impact proposed by change through projects or initiatives
Create functional requirements documents detailing current state and proposed changes and be able to clearly articulate these to impacted teams
Liaise with Technology teams, clearly communicating the development changes required for delivery and overseeing testing and sign off with business users
Generate appropriate business requirements, documents, workflows, and process maps
Analyse the usage of core and non-core data, identify opportunities to optimise or align with strategic solutions
Work with centralised Data Management teams to ensure that efforts in the Investment Management community work in synergy with those teams
Creation of repeatable data testing frameworks to ensure requirements built to your specification meet the necessary standards
Facilitate requirements gathering meetings
Leverage emerging technology and techniques to achieve your work goals in a timely manner
Liaise with stakeholders and ensure regular communications with the business, technology, and data teams
Collaborate with Data Architects to ensure all change is clearly documented by updating of conceptual and logical models and ensuring data catalogues, definitions and lineage is all aligned
Carry out other duties as assigned

What to expect when you join our firm

Hybrid working and reasonable accommodations
Generous Holiday policies
Excellent Health and Wellbeing benefits including corporate membership to ClassPass
Paid volunteer time to step away from your desk and into the community
Support to grow through professional development courses, tuition/qualification reimbursement and more
All-inclusive approach to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
Maternal/paternal leave benefits and family services
Complimentary subscription to Headspace ‚Äì the mindfulness app
All employee events including networking opportunities and social activities
Lunch allowance for use within our subsidised onsite canteen

Must have skills

Experience of working on large scale data transformation projects in a Technical Business Analyst or Data Analyst role
Experience of working within a data team or dealing with processing large amounts of data
Experience does not need to be in the Asset Management industry
Experience writing & implementing business requirements, process maps, and user stories.
Good stakeholder management skills
Strong Microsoft Excel skills
Strong SQL & Python (Pandas) skills
Experience with process mapping software applications: Visio, Lucid Charts etc.
Strong technical aptitude
Analytical, structured, and logical in approach
Attention to detail and a delivery focused mind set
Organised & collaborative

Nice to have skills

Business knowledge: Asset Management, Equity, Fixed Income, OTC and Exchange Traded Derivatives, Fund Management, Security Analytics, Client Reporting, Performance Measurement and Regulatory reporting
Previous finance experience, especially middle and back-office processes
‚ÄòBig data‚Äô analysis experience preferred
Methodologies: Agile
Machine Learning skills preferred
Systems: Charles River Development, S&P EDM (formerly CADIS), EAGLE
Scientific, Mathematical or Computer Science degree or equivalent

Supervisory responsibilities

No

Potential for growth

Mentoring
Leadership development programs
Regular training
Career development services
Continuing education courses

You will be expected to understand the regulatory obligations of the firm, and abide by the regulated entity requirements and JHI policies applicable for your role.

At Janus Henderson Investors we‚Äôre committed to an inclusive and supportive environment. We believe diversity improves results and we welcome applications from all backgrounds. Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt think you tick every box, we still want to hear from you! We understand everyone has different commitments and while we can‚Äôt accommodate every flexible working request we‚Äôre happy to be asked about work flexibility and our hybrid working environment. If you need any reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process, please get in touch and let us know at recruiter@janushenderson.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Product Analyst

¬£60,000

London (1 or 2 days p/w)




I've partnered with a business intelligence business that work in the Legal sector. They are looking for a Data Analyst, who will sit within the Product function, to help drive their digital and web analytics capability.




The business are working on multiple projects to build out new Data products, this person will play a critical role in the build of these products and the efficiency of the overall Data capability.




This role has a Google suite focus (BigQuery, GA and Google Tag Manager). GTM and tagging experience is vital to succeed in this role.




Other responsibilities include:

Optimise end-to-end tracking & insight gathering
Uncover meaningful insights in UB, product performance and key commercial metrics
Work closely with the product development team to ensure innovative data products
Develop and maintain business-wide dashboards
Be the SME for Digital Analytics in the Product and Data team




Please do apply if this role seems of interest.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:

Peaple Talent have partnered with a leading Automotive business that are playing a vital role in the industry as we transition customers to electric vehicles across the coming decade.




We are now seeking a Data Analyst to join the Asset Risk department. With a fleet of 780k+ vehicles, our client is the UK‚Äôs largest car leasing company and you will play a key role in managing the risks this brings as the automotive industry undergoes the biggest transformation it has ever seen.




Successful candidates must have a full UK Drivers License




You'll be responsible for:

Playing a vital role in understanding how changes in the wider economic and automotive landscape will impact the residual values and maintenance spends of car and wheelchair accessible vehicles.
Forecast vehicle level Residual Values and maintenance budgets for the fleet on a quarterly basis.
Collaborate with key business stakeholders including the Analytics, Pricing, VRM, Manufacturer Relations and Conversions & Adaptations teams to develop and share key insights with senior management on a timely basis.
Develop relationships with car manufacturers, retailers, vehicle converters and wider industry contacts by attending vehicle launch events and external automotive conferences




You will have the following experience:

Experience of working in an analytically oriented commercial environment
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence others
Comfortable in transforming complex data in to easily digested insights
Strong analytical, data visualisation & problem-solving experience
Working knowledge of Microsoft Power BI




Desirable:

Experience of working in an analytical role within the automotive sector

Title: Data Analyst - ¬£600 (Outside IR35) - 6 Months
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Role: Data Analyst
Location: Hybrid (remote with 3x days in Central London)
Rate: ¬£520 - ¬£600 per day (Outside)
Length: 6-months (initial)

iO Associates are excited to be working with a global consulting company based in Central London. The ideal candidate will have experience in Data Analytics and exposure to finance environments. You will be supporting on a transformation project, concerning the end-customer's wholesale lending system, requiring you to provide actionable insights to guide business strategies.

The role requires you to be on-site 3x days per week in London. The contract is 6 months initially, paying up to ¬£600 per day, Outside IR35. The client is looking for someone to start ASAP, and the interviews will be conducted in the next 2 weeks, virtually.

Skills:

Knowledge of regulatory requirements for wholesale lending (FR Y-14 is desirable)
Proven experience in data analysis and business analysis
Strong understanding of data systems and data attributes
Experience with data lineage, reconciliation, and quality assurance
Ability to identify and resolve data transformation issues
Familiarity with wholesale lending products
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Proficiency in IT skills including MS Office Suite, SQL, Collibra, Tableau, Python, and MS Power Apps

If you are coming to the end of your contract or immediately available and keen to join a global, established consultancy, don't hesitate to apply with your CV via application or email - .
