Role: Data Analyst
Location: Hybrid (remote with 3x days in Central London)
Rate: ¬£520 - ¬£600 per day (Outside)
Length: 6-months (initial)

iO Associates are excited to be working with a global consulting company based in Central London. The ideal candidate will have experience in Data Analytics and exposure to finance environments. You will be supporting on a transformation project, concerning the end-customer's wholesale lending system, requiring you to provide actionable insights to guide business strategies.

The role requires you to be on-site 3x days per week in London. The contract is 6 months initially, paying up to ¬£600 per day, Outside IR35. The client is looking for someone to start ASAP, and the interviews will be conducted in the next 2 weeks, virtually.

Skills:

  • Knowledge of regulatory requirements for wholesale lending (FR Y-14 is desirable)
  • Proven experience in data analysis and business analysis
  • Strong understanding of data systems and data attributes
  • Experience with data lineage, reconciliation, and quality assurance
  • Ability to identify and resolve data transformation issues
  • Familiarity with wholesale lending products
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Proficiency in IT skills including MS Office Suite, SQL, Collibra, Tableau, Python, and MS Power Apps

If you are coming to the end of your contract or immediately available and keen to join a global, established consultancy, don't hesitate to apply with your CV via application or email - .

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Scientist




Location: London üåÜ




Remuneration: Hourly rate ¬£35.58 üí∏




Contract Details: Temporary, until 28th February 2025 ‚åõ




Working Pattern: Full Time (Hybrid Model) ‚è∞




Are you a talented Marketing Data Scientist looking for an exciting opportunity in the thriving tech industry? Our client, a leading organisation in the tech sector, is seeking a motivated and skilled individual to join their EMEA Marketing team as a Marketing Data Scientist. üìà




Responsibilities:

Manage the workload of a large project or multiple projects to maximise impact and refine timelines in collaboration with stakeholders.
Exercise sound judgement in weighing input against anticipated impact and adapt to changes as needed.
Identify issues for defined problems, navigate unexpected complexity, and propose analytical and technical solutions.
Effectively frame and escalate issues to be addressed by managers and stakeholders.
Serve as a trusted partner within the team and with cross-functional teams, providing guidance and managing relationships with partners, agencies, or TVCs.
Contribute to shared team responsibilities and the broader analyst community, such as conducting interviews or presenting analysis findings.
Utilise expertise in data extraction and manipulation, dashboarding/visualisation, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and research techniques to drive insights and solutions.
Develop strategies to drive incremental growth by addressing complex business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders across various functions.
Conduct market research and data analysis to influence business decisions, optimise performance, and deliver best-in-class execution.
Champion an inclusive culture, creating a supportive environment, role-modelling inclusive behaviour, and driving diversity change initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis support to senior leaders for specific data requests.




Skills/Experience/Education:

Strong knowledge of business operations and driving efficiency and effectiveness within organisations.
Excellent consultative skills to understand stakeholder needs and provide tailored analysis and recommendations.
Proficiency in dashboarding to link, report, and analyse metrics based on available data.
Ability to convert real-world business problems into trackable metrics and generate meaningful insights from data analysis.
Familiarity with experimental design principles and best practises.
Good understanding of the tech industry landscape, including key players and technology trends.
Experience in marketing analysis and applying analytical methods to generate actionable insights.
Project management skills and ability to plan and execute projects effectively.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods to evaluate data adequacy and draw inferences.
Strong storytelling and presentation skills to communicate data-driven insights in an engaging manner.
Technical acumen and eagerness to learn and apply statistical and mathematical concepts.




Our client offers excellent perks, including hybrid working arrangements, pension contribution matching, employee discounts, and comprehensive well-being support. üåü




If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategies and make an impact in the tech industry, we would love to hear from you. Join our client's innovative team in London, and be a part of shaping the future of EMEA Marketing. Apply now! ‚ú®




Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.üíº




Adecco is a disability-confident employer. It is important to us that we run an inclusive and accessible recruitment process to support candidates of all backgrounds and all abilities to apply. Adecco is committed to building a supportive environment for you to explore the next steps in your career. If you require reasonable adjustments at any stage, please let us know and we will be happy to support you.

Title: Data Analyst (Middle Office) ‚Äì Global Hedge Fund ‚Äì ¬£100-125k total comp + amazing benefits!
Description:
A market leading, global hedge fund, are looking to hire a data analyst into its London operations / middle office function.




The role that we are looking to hire has a hybrid remit split across project management / data analyst (tech) responsibilities + BAU operations tasks.




The core project management component of the role (roughly 50%, albeit even more so initially whilst the hire is being trained on the subject matter) will heavily focus on process improvements / infrastructure development for the BAU remit that you‚Äôll have coverage of ‚Äì as the work is tech focused, the hire will use Python, SQL and VBA to a very strong standard in the role. Additionally, the hire will take on a large volume of ad-hoc project work for specific investment desks, focused on data analytics / fund performance metrics. The BAU component will focus on oversight of the reconciliations and settlements processes, analyzing large volumes of data to produce reports / presenting analysis to the relevant investment desks. This is a highly quantitative role.




We are looking to hire a junior that is ambitious and would like to progress within the firm ‚Äì our client is one of the most progressive firms on the street. From this role, internal moves into other areas of technology, trading assistant, risk, quant or COO function roles are plausible, as are internal international transfers.




Candidates will ideally have 1-2yrs experience in a data analyst / data management role, that has had a strong focus on process improvement and automation work. Coding skills are a pre-requisite (python and/or SQL preferred). Candidates must have a top tier STEM degree.




Whilst this is a junior level role, our client are an industry leader for compensation ‚Äì the hire can expect a year one total comp package of ¬£100-125k if they perform to a strong standard. In addition, the firm offer a very large pension, top of the range healthcare, fully subsidised gym membership, an annual allowance to use on personal development / qualifications and a restaurant serving fully subsidised breakfast & lunch daily.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Primary Details

Time Type: Full time



Worker Type: Employee

The opportunity

We have an exciting new opportunity as a Data Analyst as part of the Reinsurance Finance team in our London-based offices.

The primary focus of the role will be to provide data analysis that enables compliance to all data policies & standards as well as the provision of data in order to support business and IT solutions and reporting requirements. This includes build, test and implementation. The role also requires engagement with Data & MI team members as well as business stakeholders to understand our data ecosystem and the QBE EO business.

This an exciting opportunity for individuals looking to start or continue their career within the insurance industry, and who want to join a team of experienced and supportive colleagues.

Your new role



Be aware of the Data & IT strategy to appropriately align effort with this direction.
Positively promote the department and company, to maximize brand leverage and develop team profile.
Participate in internal meetings to share and develop strategy, knowledge and best practice.
Contribute to developing awareness of Data & MI deliverables across the business in order to ensure the highest standards of compliance.
Determine own work priorities and activities in line with team plans to ensure the achievement of personal and team objectives.
Build and maintain productive working relationships with internal stakeholders to ensure service delivery meets business needs.
Deliver data analysis to support business requirement definition and governance compliance.
Maintain, monitor and update pertinent to your team, ensuring information is accurate and presents an accurate picture of activity.
Support the design, development and implementation of fit-for-purpose data solutions for our customers.
Undertake problem investigation, analysis and resolution to maintain and improve service to customers.
Contribute to the on-going development of the services provided to ensure it continues to support and meet business needs.




About You



Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Business/Data analysis and requirements gathering skills.
Knowledge of Business Intelligence (BI) and Management Information (MI) reporting.
Effective communication and stakeholder management.
Excellent time-management.
Working knowledge and understanding of: SQL and relational databases. Data warehouse reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau, MS Reporting Services and Excel. MS Office applications, Word, PowerPoint etc.






At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job, we have adopted flexible working across the company and welcome this conversation.

Why QBE? At My Best‚ÄØ‚ÄØ



At QBE, we want our people to feel rewarded and inspired to perform at their best, that‚Äôs why we have created ‚ÄúAt My Best‚Äù. It‚Äôs our connection, our way of showing we have your back. We understand that one size doesn‚Äôt fit all and that priorities can change depending on your life stage. That is why our blend of wellbeing initiatives and benefits offer flexibility to suit what matters most to you. It‚Äôs in the culture of our business, our QBE DNA, to support our people. Everything we do is underpinned by our QBE DNA - because we know it‚Äôs not just what we do that matters, it‚Äôs how we do it that makes the difference.‚ÄØ In addition to this, we also offer flexible parental leave for both parents and have several employee network groups that support and empower our diverse workforce.‚ÄØ



At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job, we have adopted flexible working across the company and welcome this conversation.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Some of the award‚Äôs QBE are proud to have won, been a finalist for, and shortlisted for include;‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Employer of the Year 2022 Winner ‚Äì Insurance Insider‚ÄØ

British Claims Awards 2022 Winner - InsurTech Award‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Insurance Times Claims Excellence Awards 2022 Winner - Claims Product Solution of the Year‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Working Families Best Practice Awards 2021 Finalist for: Best COVID-19 Response‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Insurance Post British Insurance Awards 2022 Shortlisted for: Best Customer Care, Diversity & Inclusion Initiative of the Year 2022, Specialist Insurer of the Year (for Construction), General Insurer of the Year‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We are proud to have partnerships with organisations such as Stonewall and Working Families, and our commitment to the Women in Finance Charter, the UN Women‚Äôs Empowerment Principles and Race at Work charter helps keep us accountable and transparent‚ÄØ

Inclusion of Diversity‚ÄØ

We are striving to create a workplace culture where all our people feel included, and we are committed to building a diverse workforce that is reflective of the communities we operate in.‚ÄØ

We know that diversity of thought, background and experience enables better decision making, improves the quality of our delivery and helps us to meet the needs of our customers.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

About QBE‚ÄØ

QBE is an international insurer and reinsurer, listed on the Australian Securities Exchange and headquartered in Sydney. We employ more than 11,000 people, with a local presence in 27 countries.‚ÄØ

We are driven by our purpose of enabling a more resilient future ‚Äì helping those around us build strength and embrace change to their advantage.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We‚Äôve been cultivating resilience since 1886, when our founders started a marine insurance company in Australia to give early pioneers a safeguard against uncertainty. Today, we‚Äôre still giving our customers confidence to explore, innovate and take measured risks, secure in the knowledge they‚Äôre covered by a strong insurer.‚ÄØ

We work hard to build a culture that best supports our people, and not only represents our business, but the world around us.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

As a business insurance specialist, QBE European Operations offers a range of insurance products from the standard suite of property, casualty and motor to the specialist financial lines, marine and energy. All are tailored to the individual needs of our small, medium and large customer base.‚ÄØ

To find out more about why you should work for QBE, visit our careers website.‚ÄØ

What next?‚ÄØ

If you have a passion to contribute to QBE‚Äôs vision of enabling a more resilient future for our customers and the community, we encourage you to APPLY NOW! Simply click the ‚Äúapply‚Äù button to submit your CV and other relevant documents, and a member of our friendly Talent Acquisition team will be in contact to discuss your interest further if you meet the requirements of the role.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Please make the Talent Acquisition aware should there be any reasonable adjustments that may need to be made for the interview and the remainder of the recruitment process.‚ÄØ

How to Apply:

To submit your application, click "Apply" and follow the step by step process.

Equal Employment Opportunity:

QBE is an equal opportunity employer and is required to comply with equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction it operates.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The ideal candidate will use their passion for analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics, enabling the to improve the product. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data.
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
3+ years' Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL, BI tools (any flavour), Python nice to have

Title: Data Analyst (Part-time, Job-share, Full-time)
Description:
Location: Flexible, the majority of the team are based around Birmingham or London but we can be flexible

Closing Date: 20th August 2024

The opportunity:

We are looking for someone who has a constant drive for improvement and is passionate about data to help us better understand our business. The MI and insight you produce will have real impact on the people and processes within our global organisation so that we can better serve our customers. This role will not only be pivotal to those changes but will also be there to challenge how we do that.

Many of our employees work flexibly in a variety of different ways, including part-time, flexible hours, job share, an element of working from home or compressed hours. This is because we want the best people for our roles, and we recognise that sometimes those people aren‚Äôt available full-time. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you may need.

What you will be doing?


Data Pipeline Development: Designing, building, and improving data pipelines
Data Manipulation & Visualization: Manipulating and visualizing data to provide actionable insights
Trend Analysis: Analysing trends in data and presenting findings to stakeholders
Multi-tasking: Managing numerous Business As Usual (BAU) tasks alongside conducting deep dives into specific issues
Knowledge Sharing: Sharing knowledge amongst a team with a diverse skill set to foster a collaborative environment


Who are we looking for?


Data visualisation: Experience with Power BI is advantageous, but not a necessity
Data Management: Understanding of data management best practices
SQL or Python Coding: Experience coding in SQL/Python preferred, but not a necessity
Numerical & Analytical Skills: Highly numerate and analytical with the ability to derive insights from complex datasets
Time Management: Ability to manage your own time effectively across several priorities
A level or equivalent in Math or other numerical subject preferred


Who we are:

At Zurich we aspire to be one of the most responsible and impactful businesses in the world and the best global insurer. Together we‚Äôre creating a brighter future for our customers, our people and our planet. With over 55,000 employees in more than 170 countries, you‚Äôll feel the support of being part of a strong and stable company who are a long-standing player in the insurance industry.

We‚Äôve made a promise to each other and every employee; to focus on sustainable impact, to care about each other‚Äôs wellbeing, to use our diverse expertise to be curious and optimistic and to develop the skills needed for our future.

If you're interested in working in a dynamic and challenging environment for a company that recognises and rewards your creativity, initiatives and contributions - then Zurich could be just the place for you. Be part of something great.

Our Culture:

At Zurich, our sense of community is strong and we‚Äôre particularly passionate about diversity and inclusion, which we‚Äôve won numerous awards for. We want our people to bring the whole of themselves to work and ensure everybody is made to feel welcome, regardless of their background, beliefs or culture. We want our employees to reflect the diversity of our customers, and so are committed to treating all of our applicants fairly and with respect, irrespective of their actual or assumed background, disability or any other protected characteristic.

We‚Äôve an environment that places a real importance on our people‚Äôs wellbeing from a physical, mental, social and financial perspective. We work with our wellbeing partners and industry experts to provide the best advice and access to a wealth of lifestyle support. We‚Äôre also committed to continuous improvement and we offer access to a comprehensive range of training and development opportunities.

We‚Äôre passionate about supporting employees to help others by getting involved in volunteering, charitable and community activity. Our charitable arm, Zurich Community Trust, is one of the longest-established corporate trusts in the UK. In that time, we‚Äôve awarded grants and volunteered time to deserving causes in the UK valued at over ¬£90 million.

So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported, Love what you do. Work for us.

  • Numerical & Analytical Skills: Highly numerate and analytical with the ability to derive insights from complex datasets
  • Time Management: Ability to manage your own time effectively across several priorities
  • A level or equivalent in Math or other numerical subject preferred

Who we are:

At Zurich we aspire to be one of the most responsible and impactful businesses in the world and the best global insurer. Together we‚Äôre creating a brighter future for our customers, our people and our planet. With over 55,000 employees in more than 170 countries, you‚Äôll feel the support of being part of a strong and stable company who are a long-standing player in the insurance industry.

We‚Äôve made a promise to each other and every employee; to focus on sustainable impact, to care about each other‚Äôs wellbeing, to use our diverse expertise to be curious and optimistic and to develop the skills needed for our future.

If you're interested in working in a dynamic and challenging environment for a company that recognises and rewards your creativity, initiatives and contributions - then Zurich could be just the place for you. Be part of something great.

Our Culture:

At Zurich, our sense of community is strong and we‚Äôre particularly passionate about diversity and inclusion, which we‚Äôve won numerous awards for. We want our people to bring the whole of themselves to work and ensure everybody is made to feel welcome, regardless of their background, beliefs or culture. We want our employees to reflect the diversity of our customers, and so are committed to treating all of our applicants fairly and with respect, irrespective of their actual or assumed background, disability or any other protected characteristic.

We‚Äôve an environment that places a real importance on our people‚Äôs wellbeing from a physical, mental, social and financial perspective. We work with our wellbeing partners and industry experts to provide the best advice and access to a wealth of lifestyle support. We‚Äôre also committed to continuous improvement and we offer access to a comprehensive range of training and development opportunities.

We‚Äôre passionate about supporting employees to help others by getting involved in volunteering, charitable and community activity. Our charitable arm, Zurich Community Trust, is one of the longest-established corporate trusts in the UK. In that time, we‚Äôve awarded grants and volunteered time to deserving causes in the UK valued at over ¬£90 million.

So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported, Love what you do. Work for us.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Full time (35hr per week), permanent

Location: London / Hybrid




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing data team, this is more than a standard data role. This is an opportunity to work collaboratively.




The Data Team is responsible for collecting all the primary and secondary data required for Lumina‚Äôs products and making it accessible internally and to clients. The Data Analyst role sits within the Data Management Team, whose objective is to provide and enhance data in the right format for every type of data user. This position joins the data team reporting to the Head of Data.




As the Data Analyst your main objective is to restructure raw data from our data collection into a format that fits our databases and analyse to identify key trends, patterns and insights that inform business decisions.




What you‚Äôll be doing:




Restructuring and maintaining data into a database-friendly multi-table format for all our product trackers and bespoke research.
Implementing systems to help the optimisation of data efficiency and data quality.
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources to enrich our internal data.
Assisting in the identification, design, development, and maintenance of new and existing data tools and applications.
Troubleshooting our databases and BI tools to ensure minimal client disruption.
The setting up and maintenance of automated data processes.
Tracking KPIs of our systems and processes
Analysing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.




What you‚Äôll need:




Strong numeracy skills.
Experience with Python and a passion for learning new languages and technologies.
Strong understanding of relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server).
Advanced Excel data handling and modelling.
Analytical and problem-solving skills to spot trends, errors and highlight/rectify.
Understand the process of acquiring, cleansing, and transforming data.
Be very organised and structured.
Be able to meet deadlines and communicate progress.
Be flexible to adapt if plans change.
Be a self-starter and motivator with the ability to work in an autonomous fast paced environment.
Experience using GitHub, BitBucket, or another SCM platform.




It would be great if you also have:




Prior commercial experience, working with consumer data in a data analytics role.
Web scraping and the use of automation tools like Selenium.




Company Benefits Include:




25 days annual leave in addition to bank holidays- increasing by one additional day after 6 years, up to a maximum of 30 days.
An additional day of leave for you to take on a cultural celebration day or on your birthday if you like. A day for you! At William Reed, we call this our ‚ÄúMeDay‚Äù.
A volunteer day to take for supporting a chosen charity and giving back to the community.
Opportunity for hybrid working
Contributory Pension
Life Assurance Scheme
Group Income Protection
Enhanced family-friendly leave pay entitlements
Wellbeing benefits, including: A health care cash plan, Employee assistance programme and a 12-month wellness calendar for company-wide health, wellbeing, diversity & inclusion awareness dates.
Cycle to Work Scheme
Electric Car Scheme




Why work for us:




We provide a supportive work environment and are committed to maintaining a healthy work/life balance for all of our employees. Working for William Reed means that you will be joining a stable organisation that is committed to developing its employees and brands.




We warmly welcome and encourage applications from talented individuals of all backgrounds and characteristics.




If you need any support in accessing this opportunity, please do not hesitate to discuss this with us.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
London based - hybrid (ideally 3 days per week in the office)
Salary ¬£40k - ¬£45k + 10% bonus + benefits
SQL proficiency is required




Company overview




Join a formidable product team that is shaping the future of online advertising and advertising technology (Ad Tech). Our client (circa 100 staff) is well-funded and growing fast, with innovative solutions and an exciting product roadmap.




Their offering helps major advertisers (brands) and media agencies reach their current and future customers online; across desktop, mobile and TV.




Role overview




We are now seeking aData Analyst to work alongside other experienced Data Analysts and Product Managers to identify and deliver insights across our client's advertising technology and audience solutions - and run future experiments to help drive new innovations.




Responsibilities




Use your analytical skills to query, manipulate and transform datasets.
Convert analytical findings into actionable insights for the product team.
Collaborate with product management and data stakeholders to develop and maintain data models and performance metrics for new product experiments.
Support junior data analyst on SQL and other analytical tools and approaches




About you - must have




Data analytical experience (gained either at University, during internships or in post graduation employment).
A desire to learn and continuously develop your analytical skills, building on SQL and related technical language skills and tools.
Curious and problem-solving mindset.




Tech & Skills requirements - must have




Intermediate level SQL or equivalent
Computer Science, Stats or Mathematics related degree




Tools you'll have access to in the role and can be trained / up-skilled on




Looker and Looker Studio (equivalent to Power BI, Tableau
Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
DBT and transformation of data, pipelines and dependencies
Github and JIRA for sprint planning
...plus more depending on your technical area of interest




What‚Äôs on offer?




Hybrid home/office flexibility
Genuine and guided career progression to support your learning and growth
Extensive benefits including, but not limited to medical, health & wellness coaching, cycle to work, lifestyle benefits, retailer discounts, company pension, critical health cover + more
Active social calendar full of entertainment, rooftop events, sports-related and competitions

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Purpose

At Travelex, data is at the heart of our relationship with our customers. We analyse data in order to understand what our customers prefer and how our products perform. Our work is fast-paced although our team remains collaborative and flexible even when delivering fast.

Your role as data analyst will be to run a wide range of queries on our datasets, interpret the results, and communicate your findings to colleagues and stakeholders. You will be working with product owners, subject matter experts, managers and engineers across the company to develop deep insight on our customers and products.

You will have an end-to-end responsibility for your deliverables: from leading the work to agree the right approach, through developing, running and continuously refining your queries, all the way to presenting your results and recommending what the business should do about them. You will have significant impact on the way our business evolves, and a high level of freedom to do things in your own way.

Responsibilities

Here are key things you‚Äôll do as a data analyst in our team. The list isn‚Äôt complete: as a competent analyst, you‚Äôll bring to Travelex your own ideas of what else is needed to become a world-class data-driven business.


Work with colleagues to understand their analytical needs and convert these into robust analytical tasks
Explore data in a range of business domains, such as: retail customer behaviour; online customer behaviour; payment cards; product performance; colleague performance; HR; finance, cost and pricing
Analyse data to understand trends, gaps and anomalies
Build time series, models and forecasts
Compare the performance of products, campaigns and sales across the different geographies where Travelex operates
Help automate analytical tasks so that powerful analytics can come with little effort
Present your findings in a simple, compelling and inspiring way
Develop visualisations and infographics that will shed light on complex business questions
Derive metrics from data and build the processes to monitor these metrics over time
Have particular responsibility for data quality: defining it, monitoring it and improving it


Key Requirements

This vacancy is for someone who greatly enjoys problem-solving, simplifying complex data into simple insight, and continuous learning. Below are key requirements from our data analyst, but you don‚Äôt need to tick every box: success in our team comes in many forms!


Competent in analysing data using SQL and Python
Familiar with AWS, including databases, data services and analytics capabilities
Experienced with SageMaker
Capable of creating engaging visualisations and infographics
A strong storyteller, who can turn a big pile of numbers into an interesting narrative
Self-starter and independent, able to turn loosely-defined requirements into concrete deliverables by asking questions, taking initiative and recommending a way forward
A good team player, who enjoys brainstorming and engaging, and is able to resolve differences of opinion in a constructive way
Understands the foundations of information security and data protection
Able to learn new tools, languages and methods quickly
Have the curiosity to understand the business, its requirements and culture
Knowledge of visualisation tools (e.g. Amazon QuickSight) and data modelling techniques isn‚Äôt essential but would be an advantage
Familiarity with DBT would be an advantage
Experience of building machine learning models, and familiarity with the common ML libraries in Python, would be an advantage
Your own unique style or way of working, which will make our team diverse and original


Why Travelex?

To remain the world‚Äôs leading Foreign Exchange specialist, we focus on making our customers‚Äô lives hassle-free while they travel.

We are customer-centric and innovative. Our digital and data products are part of our investment in the future of Foreign Exchange, cross-border e-commerce and international payments.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Remote




Description:

We are seeking a Business Data Analyst to support our People Services in a large HRIS transformation project. You'll work with stakeholders to analyze and document requirements, particularly within HRIS and Payroll, ensuring seamless integration and efficiency improvements.




Key Skills and Experience:

Minimum 3 years of Business Analyst experience.
Proven track record in shared services and HR system implementations.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Experience with HR platforms like Workday, SAP, Oracle, Ceridian is a plus.
Ability to develop and monitor KPIs for process improvements.

Key Responsibilities:

Gather and document shared service requirements.
Analyze business processes and identify improvement opportunities.
Translate requirements into practical solutions with the project team.
Support the implementation and address any challenges.
Ensure alignment of shared services with project goals.
Continuously identify and implement improvements.

Title: Business Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leading independent academic and professional publisher, is seeking a Business Data and Reporting Analyst to support their Hybrid and Open Access journals‚Äô editorial function. This role involves developing and delivering analytics and reporting solutions that transform data into actionable insights.




Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Key responsibilities




Implement, manage, maintain, and develop existing reports and dashboards across the Journals Editorial function
Quickly acquire a good understanding of the critical data sources regarding availability, integrity, complexity and ownership to ensure reports and analyses are complete, consistent and understood
Troubleshoot, resolve and drive improvement to existing reporting and data visualisations, with a keen interest in automation
Effectively prioritise and manage multiple data-focused requests through delivery with a high degree of accuracy and on time completion
Help evaluate acquisitions of new third-party data sources and assist in implementing and using these sources to achieve business benefits for Editorial







Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Skills/experience




A proven record of collaborative work with other highly skilled data analysts and data coordinators to produce and present clear reports and data visualisations that are user-friendly and accessible to stakeholders
Data analyst experience and applied critical thinking and analytical skills to solve real-world business problems
Knowledge of the journal publishing industry and an understanding of Open Access business models
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office 365 apps (including advanced skills in Excel and proficiency in Power BI, along with DAX, Power Query, and Excel Power Pivot), SQL, and API integrations
Good relationship management skills and confidence in dealing with people at all levels of the business




A competitive salary, bonus, and benefits package is offered.




Referral Scheme - Telfer Partners offer a referral reward if we fill this vacancy with someone you recommend. You can send us contact details of anyone you would like to recommend to enquiries@telferpartners.com.




Equality Policy - Telfer Partners is committed to upholding a professional and impartial recruitment process. Our Equal Opportunities policy ensures that all job applicants and employees are treated fairly and equally, regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, marital status, race, nationality, religion, age, disability, or union membership status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Engineering

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: London, UK

Reporting To: Jubin Sadeghi

Compensation: ¬£30,000 - ¬£50,000 / year

Description

White Swan Data is a small but rapidly growing team of mathematicians, data scientists and software engineers who are constantly striving to refine world class betting models while also researching and deploying new ones. Our work bridges three domains, each challenging in its own right - betting and gambling, quantitative research and software development.

We are seeking a talented Data Analyst, well-versed in the R programming language, who can pull actionable insights out of large data sets. As a member of the team, you will be working on a variety of different projects and collaborating with the team to ensure we deliver to our clients needs.

We will consider graduate applicants if we feel your degree has equipped you with the necessary skills to further develop in this role.

Key Responsibilities


Dive into diverse datasets to extract meaningful patterns, trends, and insights.
Cleanse and process data to ensure accuracy and reliability in analysis.
Utilise statistical methods to interpret and validate findings, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
Develop comprehensive reports to communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Stay updated on the latest industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analytics.
Implement and maintain data quality assurance processes to ensure the reliability of analytical outputs.


Requirements

Must Have -


Proficiency in the R programming language, ideally ggplot2, tidyverse and data.table.
Advanced spreadsheeting skills, ideally google-sheets and Excel.
A passion for data analytics and a desire to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A Bachelor's degree in a data-oriented subject (statistics, econometrics, economics etc) and/or several years of highly relevant experience in data analysis using the above software.


Desirable -


Previous experience using the SQL/Sequel programming language.
Experience in creating compelling visualisations using tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or Grafana software.
Experience of data manipulation, management and reporting.
Adept at solving analytical problems with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical findings to non-technical audiences.
Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively within a team.
A passion and understanding of sports and sports betting markets/odds.


Benefits


Competitive salary depending on experience.
Annual discretionary performance bonus.
25 days holiday per annum, plus UK bank holidays.
Private health & dental insurance.
Pension plan.
Complimentary gym membership
Regular team events/socials.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Central London- 2 X Week

Up to ¬£50,000




I am working on a Data Analyst role for a tech-driven organisation, you will have lots of ownership over the PowerBI reporting platform.




Requirements

To qualify for this role, you will require:

¬∑ Strong experience with SQL and PowerBI

¬∑ Strong stakeholder management skills

Any experience with Snowflake is a plus.




Salary

A successful candidate will receive:

¬∑ A Salary of up to ¬£50,000

¬∑ Excellent progression opportunities




Process- two interview stages

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of ¬£50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - ¬£30,000
Data Analyst - ¬£50,000
Business Data Analyst - ¬£67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - ¬£80,000
Business Analysts - ¬£60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Social Data Analyst
Description:
Social Data Analyst role at a fast-growing independent performance / paid social agency.







Salary to ¬£40,000 + bonus. Based Central London (2 days required in office per week).







Summary

This role has huge growth potential ‚Äì potentially to grow the team and manage a small department in years to come
Across a range of clients with a big B2C brand focus
You will ideally have experience with Looker (or similar) and be super-interested in social analytics and presenting data in clear, translatable ways for clients
Focus is paid social but also keen to expand on organic social analytics







As a Data Analyst, you'll contribute to the agencies growth by diving deep into data from platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok to unearth insights that shape our campaigns.







The business has ambitious growth targets and are looking to organically grow to double in size by 2026. They have an inclusive working environment where team togetherness is promoted, including team lunches and Thursday night social‚Äôs.







Key Responsibilities:




Data Integration - Integrate data from multiple sources using Funnel, ensuring accuracy and accessibility for analysis.

Report Creation - Create and maintain Looker Studio reports for daily decision-making, continuously improving their accuracy and usefulness.

Experimentation - Run structured experiments, identify testing opportunities, implement them, manage rewards, and communicate results.

Data Analysis - Conduct incrementality studies, analyze trends using spreadsheets and Python notebooks, and provide detailed insights.

Tracking - Audit tracking setups, build tracking maps, and help clients troubleshoot tracking issues.







What We Need from You:




2+ years‚Äô experience within a social / data analyst role
Proficiency in using spreadsheets for daily tasks.
Strong data analysis skills to surface insights and present them clearly.
Excellent communication skills for presenting findings.
B2C client experience
Attention to detail to ensure accuracy and reliability in data handling.
Knowledge of marketing data and its complexities.
Experience with SQL, JavaScript, or Python is highly desirable.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and paid media management tools.
Experience running A/B tests and reporting findings.
Interest in AI trends and technologies for measuring metrics in social media.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Rapp

We stand up for individuality. We actively foster an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual difference are valued and leveraged to achieve the agency‚Äôs vision. And most importantly we value every individual‚Äôs wellbeing.

As a diversity champion, equal opportunities and disability confident employer and an ardent advocate of flexible working we understand that everyone has unique requirements and needs.

We are a global creative agency, but the individual really is at the heart of everything we do. We use data to find out what makes them tick. We use technology to talk to them one-to-one ‚Äì but to one million at a time. And we use creativity to encourage them to engage, click, buy and bond, again and again.

Each brand is unique and has its own individual challenges. We pride ourselves in rising to each and every one of them, for brands such as KFC, Mercedes Benz, IKEA, Paypal and Virgin Media 02.

Us

In order to foster collaboration and relationships, our hybrid model requires three office days per week. As equal opportunities proponents, we are open to discuss any hybrid working related needs during the initial screening.

Learning and Development is important. We all know that. Its why we have a dedicated Learning and Development team and offer regular career conversations and bespoke L&D programmes so that you can leave us with more than when you started.

We recognise that the work of diversity, equity and inclusion calls on all of us. That‚Äôs why we set up The Neighbourhood. A collective of people, at different stages of the DE&I journey, whether impacted or allies, dedicated to helping our colleagues take ownership and effect change across 4 key pillars; Anti-racism, Disability, Gender & LGBTQ+ and Parents & Carers.

The Health and Wellbeing of our people matters immensely. We offer Coaching opportunities for all through our partnerships with Sanctus (mental health partner who provides online coaching; you can talk about anything, personal or professional) and Sayge (1:1 professional development coaching program). We have 40 trained Mental Health First Aiders across the agency and have Babylon Health (Private GP service) for all.

You‚Äôre better at work when you feel better in yourself. So, in addition to your annual holiday, you can take a ‚ÄúMe‚Äù day and an ‚ÄúUs‚Äù day, every year. Your ‚ÄúMe‚Äù day is for you to invest in yourself ‚Äì go after a life goal, meditate, learn to paint, bake cakes or just have a duvet day watching Netflix!

Your ‚ÄúUs‚Äù day is all about giving back and helping others ‚Äì volunteer, pick litter at a local park, hang out with the elderly or raise money for a local charity.

We‚Äôre progressive and always open to new initiatives, for example we‚Äôve recently partnered with Fertifa (Leading Fertility and Reproductive Health benefit providers). Because we know the journey to becoming a family isn‚Äôt always easy (that includes men too), and we support our people through that journey whether you are new parent, experiencing the menopause, or anything else in between.

Whatever stage of life you are at, we make sure you have the tools you need to have a healthy work life balance.

US MARKETING SCIENCES

The Marketing Sciences team at RAPP is a driving force behind the agency's success, harnessing the power of data and technology. We are superconnectors, bridging the gap between creativity, data and tech to unlock limitless possibilities and disruption.

Our mission is to provide deep insights and a true robust understanding of our clients' businesses and marketing challenges. Our expertise is to empower our agency and the client to make data-driven decisions that directly impact performance and drive measurable results.

From identifying the untapped value of client data to expanding its potential through data capture, rigorous analysis, and statistical techniques, we leave no stone unturned. We are split into 4 disciplines in Marketing Sciences; Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Enablement and Data Visualisation to enable us to deliver against any client data driven challenge.

Together, we will revolutionize the way data is utilised, ensuring that every action we take contributes to the success of our clients and propels the agency forward. Welcome to a future where data and technology and your ideas push the boundaries of what's possible.

Your Role

In the Data Analytics team you will ensure both the voice of the customer and CFO are represented in the room with hard evidence. As well as supporting exceptional customer experiences using data, you will help ensure every action we take is directly improving performance against your clients objectives.

As an Analyst, you will work under supervision to deliver projects within set deadlines, utilising your strong hands on analytical capabilities. Your strengths in Python and SQL will ensure you can efficiently deliver robust analytics with guidance from your team.

Your experience with web and social analytics tools (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr) and data visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc) will enable you to uncover key insights across channels and create self-service dashboards.

You will be comfortable working as part of a team with supervision from seniors, whilst being able to execute analysis independently.

Whilst no two days will look the same, you‚Äôll be sharing findings back to more senior members of the team to shape for articulation to clients.

Under the guidance of senior members of the team you support answering strategic questions using data and forge an understanding of how to deliver personalisation at scale.

In Data Analytics you won‚Äôt be expected to build advanced segmentations and data science models, but you will develop an understanding of the art of the possible with data science, the necessary data required to fuel models and an ability to spot where a business challenge would be best supported through automation or leveraging the latest modelling techniques.

You will have a developing interest with the omni-channel landscape and be able to develop a strong understanding of how to capture and utilise data across channels, from creating tagging and taxonomy to measurement with web analytics tools.

Once you join the team, you will be onboarded to our product suite and playbooks and be capable of articulating and following these best-in-class approaches.

The ideal candidate is ready to jump in. Find problems. Fix them. Build relationships. Stay up-to-date with the latest innovations. Do whatever it takes to go above and beyond. And stand up for individuality.

Your Responsibilities

Management


You will be mentored to understand how to become a manager
You will follow the direction of your line manager and manage upwards when needed


Client


Understanding clients‚Äô objectives, their business and KPIs and step change their businesses through the power of data
Deliver and understand the role of the work briefed to you
Challenge the briefs and ambition of the work
Build relationships with analysts client side
Support the creation of best-in-class, statistically significant, measurement and reporting
Collaborate in a results-driven, test, learn and optimisation culture for the client
Communicate analytical outputs
Ensure deliverables are completed on time and learn to deliver presentation quality
Follow robust, scalable and efficient processes for delivery

New Business / PR


Be aware of our new business pitches and work we are doing
Participate in thought pieces / case studies / award entries showing off your work to the industry


Network


Understand our network and other players within it


Evolution


Focus on your constant evolution - Show a desire to learn and develop core analytical skills
Understand your strengths and weaknesses and train accordingly


Your Skills And Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative subject (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics) or Social Sciences, with heavy emphasis on quantitative methods; Master‚Äôs degree or PHD is a plus. Degree will not be required with appropriate work experience.
1 ‚Äì 2 years of relevant experience in marketing analytics, customer experience insights, performance optimization, ideally in a marketing agency or management consulting practice.
You will be expected to have an understanding and with guidance utilise our core technical skills:
Core analytical languages and software (Excel, SQL, Python, Alteryx)
Statistics
Data Visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc)
Web and Social Analytics (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr)
Value engineering / Business casing
Performance Measurement and Measurement Frameworks
Data Protection / GDPR
Customer journey analysis and planning
Brief planning and writing
Progressive data capture
Segmentation and Modelling
Martech design and ecosystem tracking (tagging and taxonomy)
Developing knowledge of experimental / multivariate test design techniques.
Growing knowledge of 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data
Confident, conscientious, self-starter, a good work ethic, and capable of building good working relationships with clients as well as other team members.
Naturally curious, imaginative and have a practical approach to problem solving.
Experience jumping in, finding problems across data and process, and fixing them.
Ability to work independently as well with a team in an agile and fast environment.
Ability to develop, learn, follow and adapt repeatable processes or products to drive efficiency and consistency of delivery.


Recruitment process

We‚Äôre not a 9 stage interview process agency. We like to keep recruitment swift, lean and individual and find that 2 or 3 stages gives all parties the opportunity to get to know each other. Plus we have a team on hand to answer questions throughout the process.

We are RAPP. And we can‚Äôt wait to meet you
Show more

    • Ability to work independently as well with a team in an agile and fast environment.
    • Ability to develop, learn, follow and adapt repeatable processes or products to drive efficiency and consistency of delivery.

    Recruitment process

    We‚Äôre not a 9 stage interview process agency. We like to keep recruitment swift, lean and individual and find that 2 or 3 stages gives all parties the opportunity to get to know each other. Plus we have a team on hand to answer questions throughout the process.

    We are RAPP. And we can‚Äôt wait to meet you

Title: Specialty Data Analyst
Description:
Specialty Data Analyst to help drive forward some of our most challenging and exciting data initiatives within a specific team/practice in the Specialty insurance division.





Summary of the role


You will work within our Specialty broking division, as Data Analyst. Your work will be integral to help support and grow our client base through innovative application of data and technology. You will play a pivotal part understanding data from various sources, ensuring its accuracy and participating in the build of client deliverables to support other Data Analysts and brokers themselves.





Responsibilities


Solve problems and create new opportunities through the use of data.


Generate insights and build case studies for existing clients.


Use specialist tools to manipulate data into meaningful and actionable insights in a timely manner.


Analysing data to identify trends.


Researching new ways to make use of data.


Engaging with other data teams across the group, including the Data team in IT.





Requirements


Experience in the Specialty Insurance sector; London Market and/or globally.


Attention to detail, with the ability to grasp insurance financials quickly.


In-depth experience in MS Excel, Python, SQL and/or R, Databricks


Familiar with PowerBI and/or other visualisation tools.


An engaging and inquisitive personality, always looking to solve problems and find solutions.



Background in maths/statistics/sciences


Business acumen, arithmetic skills and intellectual curiosity.


Excellent stakeholder management skills.


Familiar with the principles of UX/UI.





Desirable extra skills and experience:


Any other relevant data analysis tools and techniques.





What we offer


Competitive salary & generous pensions


Individual private medical cover via Bupa


26 weeks full pay maternity leave / 4 weeks full pay paternity leave


Agile working arrangements


A wide variety of wellbeing offers: Employee Assistance Programme, Cycle to Work (up to ¬£5k), Digital GP services, Mental Wellbeing support apps





You should apply if you want‚Ä¶


a career that you define


an access to on-the-job learning and upscale courses (e.g. Chartered Insurance Institute course and certification)


to join a group that considers their people as its chief competitive advantage


to be a part of the place where everyone has a voice



to make a difference - not just in the workplace, but in the industry and in the wider community


if you are passionate about a constantly evolving working environment and challenges

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
London based - hybrid (ideally 3 days per week in the office)
Salary ¬£40k - ¬£45k + 10% bonus + benefits
SQL proficiency is required




Company overview




Join a formidable product team that is shaping the future of online advertising and advertising technology (Ad Tech). Our client (circa 100 staff) is well-funded and growing fast, with innovative solutions and an exciting product roadmap.




Their offering helps major advertisers (brands) and media agencies reach their current and future customers online; across desktop, mobile and TV.




Role overview




We are now seeking aData Analyst to work alongside other experienced Data Analysts and Product Managers to identify and deliver insights across our client's advertising technology and audience solutions - and run future experiments to help drive new innovations.




Responsibilities




Use your analytical skills to query, manipulate and transform datasets.
Convert analytical findings into actionable insights for the product team.
Collaborate with product management and data stakeholders to develop and maintain data models and performance metrics for new product experiments.
Support junior data analyst on SQL and other analytical tools and approaches




About you - must have




Data analytical experience (gained either at University, during internships or in post graduation employment).
A desire to learn and continuously develop your analytical skills, building on SQL and related technical language skills and tools.
Curious and problem-solving mindset.




Tech & Skills requirements - must have




Intermediate level SQL or equivalent
Computer Science, Stats or Mathematics related degree




Tools you'll have access to in the role and can be trained / up-skilled on




Looker and Looker Studio (equivalent to Power BI, Tableau
Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
DBT and transformation of data, pipelines and dependencies
Github and JIRA for sprint planning
...plus more depending on your technical area of interest




What‚Äôs on offer?




Hybrid home/office flexibility
Genuine and guided career progression to support your learning and growth
Extensive benefits including, but not limited to medical, health & wellness coaching, cycle to work, lifestyle benefits, retailer discounts, company pension, critical health cover + more
Active social calendar full of entertainment, rooftop events, sports-related and competitions

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Rakuten Viber is one of the most popular and downloaded apps in the world. Working with us provides a unique opportunity to influence hundreds of millions of our users and to be part of the journey that makes us a super-app. Our mission is to make people‚Äôs lives easier by enabling meaningful connections, from precious moments with family and friends, through managing business relationships to pursuing their passions.

Our Data Analyst team provides insights on how millions of users interact with our products. As a Data Analyst, you will be part of the Business Solutions unit and deliver insights that translate directly into business growth.

Working hand-in-hand with the global managers for each region, you will spot new opportunities, challenge the status quo, and present your findings back to the leadership team. We are looking for an experienced, hands-on individual with both strong technical skills (SQL, Python / R, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Excel, Looker, etc.) and a business mindset.

Responsibilities:


Deliver cutting-edge analytics projects optimizing across regions, channels, and analytical functions
Report on key performance metrics against targets on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis and provide actionable insights to improve performance
Liaise with stakeholders, such as Product, Marketing, Analytics and Data Science teams to drive step changes in growth
Share expertise and best practices within analytical functions to develop a shared center of excellence
Proactively craft stories from data to clearly identify opportunities in improving user experiences
Build and maintain reporting dashboards, reports, and data models


Requirements:


2+ years experience in a role equivalent to data or business analysis
Analytical and problem-solving skills
An ability to communicate complex findings to key stakeholders in a clear, simple way
Knowledge of A/B testing principles and statistical analysis techniques
Good command of Excel, experience with SQL and BI software (ideally Tableau, Looker or similar)
BSc degree (or higher) in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or any other quantitative field


Advantages:


Experience in product analytics role with driving impact and shaping product direction
Experience with Python and ETL
Experience with simple ML algorithms and technical skills

Title: Business Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leading independent academic and professional publisher, is seeking a Business Data and Reporting Analyst to support their Hybrid and Open Access journals‚Äô editorial function. This role involves developing and delivering analytics and reporting solutions that transform data into actionable insights.




Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Key responsibilities




Implement, manage, maintain, and develop existing reports and dashboards across the Journals Editorial function
Quickly acquire a good understanding of the critical data sources regarding availability, integrity, complexity and ownership to ensure reports and analyses are complete, consistent and understood
Troubleshoot, resolve and drive improvement to existing reporting and data visualisations, with a keen interest in automation
Effectively prioritise and manage multiple data-focused requests through delivery with a high degree of accuracy and on time completion
Help evaluate acquisitions of new third-party data sources and assist in implementing and using these sources to achieve business benefits for Editorial







Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Skills/experience




A proven record of collaborative work with other highly skilled data analysts and data coordinators to produce and present clear reports and data visualisations that are user-friendly and accessible to stakeholders
Data analyst experience and applied critical thinking and analytical skills to solve real-world business problems
Knowledge of the journal publishing industry and an understanding of Open Access business models
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office 365 apps (including advanced skills in Excel and proficiency in Power BI, along with DAX, Power Query, and Excel Power Pivot), SQL, and API integrations
Good relationship management skills and confidence in dealing with people at all levels of the business




A competitive salary, bonus, and benefits package is offered.




Referral Scheme - Telfer Partners offer a referral reward if we fill this vacancy with someone you recommend. You can send us contact details of anyone you would like to recommend to enquiries@telferpartners.com.




Equality Policy - Telfer Partners is committed to upholding a professional and impartial recruitment process. Our Equal Opportunities policy ensures that all job applicants and employees are treated fairly and equally, regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, marital status, race, nationality, religion, age, disability, or union membership status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Primary Details

Time Type: Full time



Worker Type: Employee

The opportunity

We have an exciting new opportunity as a Data Analyst as part of the Reinsurance Finance team in our London-based offices.

The primary focus of the role will be to provide data analysis that enables compliance to all data policies & standards as well as the provision of data in order to support business and IT solutions and reporting requirements. This includes build, test and implementation. The role also requires engagement with Data & MI team members as well as business stakeholders to understand our data ecosystem and the QBE EO business.

This an exciting opportunity for individuals looking to start or continue their career within the insurance industry, and who want to join a team of experienced and supportive colleagues.

Your new role



Be aware of the Data & IT strategy to appropriately align effort with this direction.
Positively promote the department and company, to maximize brand leverage and develop team profile.
Participate in internal meetings to share and develop strategy, knowledge and best practice.
Contribute to developing awareness of Data & MI deliverables across the business in order to ensure the highest standards of compliance.
Determine own work priorities and activities in line with team plans to ensure the achievement of personal and team objectives.
Build and maintain productive working relationships with internal stakeholders to ensure service delivery meets business needs.
Deliver data analysis to support business requirement definition and governance compliance.
Maintain, monitor and update pertinent to your team, ensuring information is accurate and presents an accurate picture of activity.
Support the design, development and implementation of fit-for-purpose data solutions for our customers.
Undertake problem investigation, analysis and resolution to maintain and improve service to customers.
Contribute to the on-going development of the services provided to ensure it continues to support and meet business needs.




About You



Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Business/Data analysis and requirements gathering skills.
Knowledge of Business Intelligence (BI) and Management Information (MI) reporting.
Effective communication and stakeholder management.
Excellent time-management.
Working knowledge and understanding of: SQL and relational databases. Data warehouse reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau, MS Reporting Services and Excel. MS Office applications, Word, PowerPoint etc.






At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job, we have adopted flexible working across the company and welcome this conversation.

Why QBE? At My Best‚ÄØ‚ÄØ



At QBE, we want our people to feel rewarded and inspired to perform at their best, that‚Äôs why we have created ‚ÄúAt My Best‚Äù. It‚Äôs our connection, our way of showing we have your back. We understand that one size doesn‚Äôt fit all and that priorities can change depending on your life stage. That is why our blend of wellbeing initiatives and benefits offer flexibility to suit what matters most to you. It‚Äôs in the culture of our business, our QBE DNA, to support our people. Everything we do is underpinned by our QBE DNA - because we know it‚Äôs not just what we do that matters, it‚Äôs how we do it that makes the difference.‚ÄØ In addition to this, we also offer flexible parental leave for both parents and have several employee network groups that support and empower our diverse workforce.‚ÄØ



At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job, we have adopted flexible working across the company and welcome this conversation.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Some of the award‚Äôs QBE are proud to have won, been a finalist for, and shortlisted for include;‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Employer of the Year 2022 Winner ‚Äì Insurance Insider‚ÄØ

British Claims Awards 2022 Winner - InsurTech Award‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Insurance Times Claims Excellence Awards 2022 Winner - Claims Product Solution of the Year‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Working Families Best Practice Awards 2021 Finalist for: Best COVID-19 Response‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Insurance Post British Insurance Awards 2022 Shortlisted for: Best Customer Care, Diversity & Inclusion Initiative of the Year 2022, Specialist Insurer of the Year (for Construction), General Insurer of the Year‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We are proud to have partnerships with organisations such as Stonewall and Working Families, and our commitment to the Women in Finance Charter, the UN Women‚Äôs Empowerment Principles and Race at Work charter helps keep us accountable and transparent‚ÄØ

Inclusion of Diversity‚ÄØ

We are striving to create a workplace culture where all our people feel included, and we are committed to building a diverse workforce that is reflective of the communities we operate in.‚ÄØ

We know that diversity of thought, background and experience enables better decision making, improves the quality of our delivery and helps us to meet the needs of our customers.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

About QBE‚ÄØ

QBE is an international insurer and reinsurer, listed on the Australian Securities Exchange and headquartered in Sydney. We employ more than 11,000 people, with a local presence in 27 countries.‚ÄØ

We are driven by our purpose of enabling a more resilient future ‚Äì helping those around us build strength and embrace change to their advantage.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We‚Äôve been cultivating resilience since 1886, when our founders started a marine insurance company in Australia to give early pioneers a safeguard against uncertainty. Today, we‚Äôre still giving our customers confidence to explore, innovate and take measured risks, secure in the knowledge they‚Äôre covered by a strong insurer.‚ÄØ

We work hard to build a culture that best supports our people, and not only represents our business, but the world around us.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

As a business insurance specialist, QBE European Operations offers a range of insurance products from the standard suite of property, casualty and motor to the specialist financial lines, marine and energy. All are tailored to the individual needs of our small, medium and large customer base.‚ÄØ

To find out more about why you should work for QBE, visit our careers website.‚ÄØ

What next?‚ÄØ

If you have a passion to contribute to QBE‚Äôs vision of enabling a more resilient future for our customers and the community, we encourage you to APPLY NOW! Simply click the ‚Äúapply‚Äù button to submit your CV and other relevant documents, and a member of our friendly Talent Acquisition team will be in contact to discuss your interest further if you meet the requirements of the role.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Please make the Talent Acquisition aware should there be any reasonable adjustments that may need to be made for the interview and the remainder of the recruitment process.‚ÄØ

How to Apply:

To submit your application, click "Apply" and follow the step by step process.

Equal Employment Opportunity:

QBE is an equal opportunity employer and is required to comply with equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction it operates.
