    • Ability to develop, learn, follow and adapt repeatable processes or products to drive efficiency and consistency of delivery.

    Recruitment process

    We‚Äôre not a 9 stage interview process agency. We like to keep recruitment swift, lean and individual and find that 2 or 3 stages gives all parties the opportunity to get to know each other. Plus we have a team on hand to answer questions throughout the process.

    We are RAPP. And we can‚Äôt wait to meet you

Title: Data & Insight Analyst
Description:
About MedShr

MedShr is the world‚Äôs leading clinical case discussion platform, enabling clinicians to securely share and discuss clinical images and cases within a global professional network. Developed by doctors and launched from London in 2015, MedShr is growing rapidly with over 2.8 million members in 195 countries, working in partnership with hundreds of national and specialist medical societies across all clinical specialties.

MedShr also provides a unique digital channel for the pharmaceutical and device industry to engage with physicians and provide independent medical education at scale to the relevant doctor and healthcare professional audiences. MedShr is working with global pharmaceutical and medical device clients to reach and engage clinicians around specific educational objectives in a disease area.

Our Mission

Our mission is to empower doctors and health care professionals to share their knowledge and skills to improve patient care and save lives.

Who We Are Looking For

We are looking for an experienced Data & Insight Analyst to join our commercial partnerships team as we deliver world class medical education programs to leading pharmaceutical and medical device companies.

We are open to applicants from all industries, however the role would best suit an analyst with a strong interest in the health tech industry.

Your Mission

To use SQL to create dashboards, analyse and interpret data for customer performance reports, and utilise strong communication skills to present actionable insights and information to stakeholders.

You will be directly supporting the commercial and growth & engagement teams, reporting to the Senior Data Analyst.

Your Responsibilities


Develop and utilise dashboards for our commercial programs (we use Google LookerStudio, but a background in any tool is fine)
Track and analyse member activity, make data driven recommendations on how we can improve our program metrics
Build client insight reports and present the data to stakeholders (both internal and external), telling a story and highlighting the value of MedShr
Make improvements to reporting and processes, build a culture of data efficiency
Support Community team with digital campaign configuration, delivery and tracking (training provided)
Support the Sales team with projections and proposals for current and future partners
Working as part of a cross-functional team of Clinical Experts, Account Managers, Community and Technical specialists


Successful Candidates will have:


2+ years of experience in a professional Data Analyst role
Proficient in SQL and analytics visualisation tools like Google Data / Looker Studio
Advanced Excel skills are essential
Ability to visualise data that tells a story and communicate relevant points of the analysis clearly
A self-starter with strong attention to detail, problem-solving skills and a track record of on-time project delivery
Excellent communication, teamwork and interpersonal skills
Enjoy startup environments and have an interest in healthcare/health tech


Desirable: Python, Experience working in a Data warehouse environment (GCP)

Work Pattern

Full-time (40hrs/week)

üí∞ Compensation

¬£40,000 per annum

Benefits

üè†Flexible

MedShr operate a core hours policy between 9.30am and 4.30pm.

This is a hybrid role with 2 days in the London Office (nearest tube station: Barons Court).

üå¥ Base holiday

25 days base holiday, plus UK bank holidays

üè¶ Pension employer contribution

MedShr will contribute 5% towards your pension

üåç Our culture

What is it like to work at MedShr? We are a diverse and inclusive team made up of many nationalities and backgrounds. Our supportive and collaborative culture, paired with the dynamic energy of a startup environment, offers you ample opportunities to challenge yourself and try new things. We believe in maintaining work-life balance and as a team we come together for socials, pub visits and our infamous coffee walks!

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Data Quality Analyst * Reinsurance / Insurance / Financial Services * City of London * Permanent * c. ¬£50,000 p.a. plus bonus and benefits




Data Quality Analyst is required for a highly successful insurance/reinsurance company to join the reinsurance team, reporting into the Director of Reinsurance Data Quality. This is a fantastic opportunity to work for a growing, ambitious company who work hard to retain a positive family feel within the business.




This is a permanent position, working on a hybrid basis 3 in the office and 2 days from home. In reward you will be paid a salary of ¬£50,000 p.a. plus bonus and benefits.




The successful Data Quality Analyst must have:




Outstanding analytical skills.
Data Quality experience ideally within insurance/financial services.
Advance Excel skills.
Degree or equivalent.
Experience within insurance/reinsurance market would also be highly beneficial.




Data Quality Analyst duties include:




Utilise, develop and maintain internal data diagnostic tool to regularly record, monitor and report data completeness, data quality and data integrity on all financial records to ensure:
Consistent measurement of data completeness, data accuracy and integrity.
Controls are reviewed and updated to attest to good governance.
Areas of weakness that require improvement are identified.
Appropriate root cause analysis is undertaken, and recommendations made.
Monitor gaps in reserve reporting.
Work with IT provider to leverage automated routines to measure data quality gaps and inefficiencies.
Support FP&A team with ad-hoc requests on data completion.




If you have the above skills and experience and want to learn more about this position then please apply via the job board for consideration.

Title: Player Insight Analyst
Description:
Join our journey to create a new experience for the National Lottery and help us to power change for the greater good.

About us:

We are Allwyn UK, part of the Allwyn Entertainment Group - a multi-national lottery operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus and Italy. We have been officially awarded the Fourth Licence (10 year licence) to operate the National Lottery starting February 2024.

‚ÄçWe've developed ground-breaking technologies, built player protection frameworks, and have a proven track record of making lotteries better. Our aim is to create one of the UK's most inclusive organisations - where people can bring the best of themselves, to do their best work, every day, for the benefit of good causes.

While the main contribution of the National Lottery to society is through the funds to good causes, at Allwyn we put our purpose and values at the heart of everything we do. Join us as we embark on a once-in-a-lifetime, largescale transformation journey to build a bigger, better, and safer National Lottery that delivers more money to good causes.

Role Purpose:

Every week, millions of people play National Lottery games online, via the National Lottery website or App. Understanding the behaviours of our growing number of digital players is crucial, to enable business growth and generate more returns to good causes.

Working within the CRM team, the Player Insight Analyst is responsible for extracting, manipulating and analysing digital customer data to derive actionable insights that drive marketing strategies and business decisions. This role helps to generate a deep understanding of player behaviour and shape our approach to customer engagement and retention.

You will be responsible for owning, maintaining and developing key performance reports, to support regular trading and digital performance understanding.

Additionally, you will undertake ad-hoc customer analytics projects. An example could involve investigating how many digital EuroMillions players we have, what their demographic profile is, what combinations of games they play and how often, how they navigate our website or app and what are their main triggers or barriers to play, to understand what works or doesn't work within our marketing and products.

Role Responsibilities:

Analytics


Use a variety of analytical tools (e.g. SQL, Excel, PowerBI, Adobe) and methods to deliver regular reports and deep dive strategic analytics
Contribute towards maintaining and developing regular player performance reports
Automate reports where possible and work with technology to evolve and optimise dashboards


Insight


Using new or existing data from a variety of sources, create concise, impactful presentations with meaningful insights and recommendation
Communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences


Stakeholder Management


Collaborate with marketing and commercial planning teams to translate data insights into actionable strategies
Build strong network of relationships with stakeholders across departments to enable things to get done quickly and effectively


Key Skills and Experience:


1 years' experience or a higher level education qualification in a relevant field (data analysis, mathematics, statistics, business)
Proficiency in using Excel and SQL (or other programming language such as R, Python) to manipulate large volumes of data
Experience with visualization tools such as PowerBI, and web analytics tools such as Adobe/Piano is an advantage, however training can be provided to support these
Passionate about understanding customer behaviours
Demonstrated ability to work independently in a deadline oriented environment#
Ability to evaluate quantitative data sets and determine "big picture" implications
Ability to handle multiple projects in a deadline driven environment
Excellent attention to detail


Our goal is to create one of the UK's most inclusive organisations - where people can bring the best of themselves, to do their best work, every day, for the benefit of good causes.

Allwyn is an Equal Opportunity Employer which prides itself in being diverse and inclusive. We do not tolerate discrimination, harassment, or victimisation in the workplace. All employment decisions at Allwyn are based on the business needs, the job requirements, and the individual qualifications. Allwyn encourages applications from individuals regardless of age, disability (visible or hidden), sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

Benefits


34 days paid leave (This includes bank holidays)
2 x Life Days
4 x Salary of Life Insurance
Pension: We'll contribute 8.5%
BUPA
¬£500 wellness allowance
Income Protection
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (24months Contract )
Description:
Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity, and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Serving an array of industries worldwide ‚Äî including home and personal care, apparel, general retail, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals, and automotive ‚Äî we employ approximately 35,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Our reported sales in 2023 were $8.4 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.

Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our Talent Acquisition team via Requestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com.



Job Description



As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play a critical role in driving data-driven decision-making for our organization. Leveraging your expertise in ERP systems and data analysis, you will be responsible for extracting, interpreting, and visualizing key performance metrics to inform strategic project planning and execution. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate complex technical information into clear, actionable insights that enable optimized project delivery and continuous process improvement.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain standardized data extraction and reporting processes from the organization's ERP systems (Mainly Oracle EBS R12 and Fusion)

Conduct in-depth analyses of project performance data to identify opportunities for optimization and efficiency gains

Design dynamic dashboards and visualizations to enable real-time monitoring of key project metrics

Communicate findings and recommendations to project managers, executives, and other stakeholders in a clear and compelling manner

Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques, and implement new solutions to enhance reporting capabilities

Provide technical support and training to end-users on ERP system functionality and reporting

Collaborate with IT, finance, and operations teams to ensure data integrity and accessibility



Qualifications



We are looking for candidates who are highly motivated and thriving in a dynamic and collaborative environment. What we also expect from you:

1-3 years Finance, Business Intelligence or related experience
Skilled in proficiently using computers and related software in performing financial job tasks, specifically setting up spreadsheet formulas, linking spreadsheets, extracting data and validating new models vs existing reports
Affinity to analytical systems and experience using Business Intelligence technology with a Financial perspective is a must
Experienced in communicating complex ideas effectively, both orally and in writing, and making presentations to cross functional teams. Ability to work well with all levels of management and employees.
Knowledge of research methodologies. Ability to conduct research, prepare comprehensive and accurate reports and present complex financial and statistical information in a clear and succinct fashion.


Additional Information



Additional information

Who we are! - Our Story:

Each of us, Every day! Eight Values. One Team!

We understand diversity and equal opportunities as enrichment for our future-oriented work at Avery Dennison. With us, teams are balanced and diverse. Because each of us is unique, and we appreciate bringing together different personalities and talents.

Avery Dennison is an equal-opportunity employer. You are interested in knowing more about our Diversity & Inclusion approach? Please go to averydennison.com/en/home/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion.html

At Avery Dennison, we do what we love, and we love what we do - Just click here, and get us to know even better: Life @ Avery Dennison (linkedin.com/company/avery-dennison/life/emea)
